No issue at all.Because of cloudy weather I haven't had a chance to take my own photo of the moon but I will as soon as it clears up.  Photos are sharp and crisp.  Camera is very intuitive and easy to use.  I hate to say this but I have yet to crack the owner's manual.  Pretty easy to figure out on your own.

Reviews.Title: price increase
Reviews.Author: Erica Coloutti
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera. It is easy to use and a great product for the price. It is sad that the price has gone up $50.00 in the last week. I do not understand why when we are supposed to be having sales for the holiday. I am disappointed in Amazon for that reason.

Reviews.Title: Price vs. Quality vs.picture results equals a good buy.
Reviews.Author: R. Duffy
Reviews.Content: As a very amateur photographer I am very satisfied with this automatic camera. My only previous experience had been 35mm film and the camera on my smartphone. I bought it especially for the 30x zoom. The HD movie function is just an added plus. For me, it takes very acceptable low light photos.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: sheraz
Reviews.Content: this camera takes great pictures  but video quality is more clear and of high quality.Love this camera and its optical zoom

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: rebecca l.
Reviews.Content: I am so in love with this camera! it take beautiful pictures! I had a kodak easy share before this and I wanted to upgrade to something with instant shutter speed to keep up with my active 2 yr old. This looks very professional and did I mention it takes beautiful pictures? I read all the reviews and shopped very carefully since I wanted to make sure it was worth 200 bucks. I am very glad that I chose this camera. You will be too!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: ha
Reviews.Content: Perfect Camera, Takes great pictures and Video. Multiple quality settings. Types of Pictures settings are great. Comes with batteries and ready to go. The zoom is the best part of this. Best camera for the lowest price. You cant put a lens on it but it is still great. Its just a bit cheaper than the one at bestbuy. The memory cards are way cheaper online.

Reviews.Title: Superzoom, super value
Reviews.Author: cyberdoc
Reviews.Content: Just used this camera for a family trip to New York City. It fit the bill perfectly as a combination of a compact 16MP 30X optical superzoom stills camera and a 1080P stereo camcorder in an all-in-one device. Together with a compact high-quality travel tripod, the package was near ideal. On past trips I have lugged around big SLRs, DLSRs, pro compacts (Canon Powershot), point-and-shoot cameras, tripods, etc. trying to balance weight, inconvenience, # hands required vs. acceptable quality, and the Coolpix L820 has been the best so far. It imposes the fewest trade-offs for acceptably high-quality photos/videos in nonprofessional usage. It is not a pro camera in terms of ruggedness or water seal, but at its price it's a huge value.

Reviews.Title: This Coolpix L820 is the BEST
Reviews.Author: Ronald Timothy
Reviews.Content: Nikon I love your L820-Just what I needed to compliment my community activist activity, Good response with the HD and the night vision availability with this camera I sometimes forget there is a flash system within the camera. To me this product can be used by real professionals because it provides all you need and I mean under whatever conditions you find yourself having to record the environment you don't have to rely on an SLR because you have SLR availability without having to change lens.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This may not be the greatest camera available, but for an advanced amatuer it's nearly perfect. Both stills and video come out clear and crisp. It's a point-and-shoot when that's all you need yet has advanced settings and functions for when you feel more creative. The focal length allows for well-focused close shots as well as distant images. It's light and easy to hold. Downloading images to Picasa or another application is as easy as connecting a USB cable or inserting the memory card in your reader. It takes standard AA batteries.In summery, it's an easy to use camera that doesn't require an advanced degree in photography. But if you have one you'll likely enjoy using it, too.

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something smaller than a more professional type camera and I have the small Coolpix but wanted better quality pictures, so I decided on this camera.  It has many photo settings and most stuff I have no clue on how to use.  It took great pictures and movies.  I love the stabilization setting since many times I was taking photos out of the car window.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but ours had been USED!
Reviews.Author: Howard L. Gault
Reviews.Content: This is a truly wonderful camera.  The size, design, and tech that Nikon put into this handy package are simply stellar!  The pictures that are rendered are a wonderment in light conditions that varied from Alaskan bright, to night on the sea after sunset with the cruise ships light reflected on the ocean.  It got them all just right, without my having to intervene and attempt modifying the settings.  AMAZING!Now, the bad part.  I ordered a NEW camera.  When I opened the box, things that should have been separate were already installed on the camera (batteries and lens cap).  The lens cap was missing the attachment lanyard.  Further investigation showed the exposure counter at 246, AND the internal memory had a photo and a short movie on it.  We were leaving on our cruise the next day, so it was not possible to return it for credit and receive a replacement.  After contacting Amazon, they offered a $40 rebate on the price, offered me the option to return the camera for a full refund after returning from our trip, and apologized for the error.  I COULD NOT HAVE ASKED FOR MORE!I took the camera to Alaska with trepidation, but it performed well indeed.  It is a keeper, but this is a cautionary tale for consumers and for Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Option Overload. A Good Thing.
Reviews.Author: patrick
Reviews.Content: The camera fits nicely in the hand. most critical buttons and options are a thumb click away. Camera does much. For example, on a recent photo safari, the 30X zoom allow us to capture high res versions of brightly colored birds not possible for others with standard point and clicks or smart phones. (Recommend a monopod for better stability the zoomed in shots.), We were able to capture after sunset images that others could not. Did not like not having SLR capabilities, but the price differential made it easy to adjust to the subtle lack of total control. Highly recommend it for people on a limited budget but with unlimited events, and activities to shoot.

Reviews.Title: very easily broken
Reviews.Author: kerry l. bender
Reviews.Content: I purchased mine in dec and by may it is broken and not repairable. The battery door is very cheaply made and your card is in there so you open it alot. 2 areas on the camera body have broken off not allowing the door to stay closed! very poor construction.

Reviews.Title: It's good
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: It's good camera.Takes nice pictures, great zoom.Umm... Sometimes pictures are blurry, trying to be very still, but can't get it right... Maybe I don't know something.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that this is a great camera. I've had this for less than a wk, which I did the one-day shipping. I gave this camera a rating of 5 stars, because I like how sleek & stylish this is. I love the bright red color. I tested out a couple of the scene effects. Used the Easy Auto Mode, which is great. Took 1 video, which I used in continuous mode. The menu is easy to use. The battery compartment area/memory card is okay, I guess. I read a couple reviews of this camera about shutting the battery cover without damaging the batteries and memory card. The first time I put the 4 AA batteries (which are included) in & closed the battery cover, I had a little trouble but got it closed safely & carefully. The battery life is good. I like the comfort of holding the camera, especially with the black non-rubber area in the upper right corner on the back of the camera. This is my first DSLR -- Point & Shoot camera. I do have a Canon (My very own 1st camera) compact camera, which is nice, but wanted an updated & newer one. I just bought a camera case/bag designed for a dslr camera for under $20 at a store, which I would have bought one online, but didn't want to spend extra money on camera accessories. Overall, this is an excellent camera for those who are entry level dslr experience & want to take professional like photos.PROS: Stylish, Easy to Hold, Battery Life, 30x zoom, and the Red colorCONS: Couldn't think of any except maybe the Battery CoverI would recommend this camera to anyone who wants to show there talent as a photographer, even if you're a professional photographer, hobbyist, or amateur.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love this camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought myself a Christmas present this year and I have been quite happy with it.  This camera is small enough that it doesn't feel cumbersome to carry around, and it's fairly light weight so it isn't heavy around your neck.  The quality of my zoom shots now is incredible.  I am totally blown away with how much detail I can get.  I'm still learning and playing with the various features and have yet to perfect the timing for live-action shots to get exactly the kind of picture I want, but that will come with practice.  But so far, I have been super happy.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: Beverly A. Martin "bowlerholic"
Reviews.Content: Fabulous! This is the camera I have been looking for! I have an online shop and it is necessary to take clear, sharp photos so that anything I'm selling looks just as good online as it does in person. I still need to learn how to use this camera, which I will be doing this week.

Reviews.Title: great little simple camera
Reviews.Author: May
Reviews.Content: Not understanding how anyone could give a negative review on this little gem. Lightweight and easy to use. I carry mine everywhere and it takes great pictures

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L820 16MP Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Blackburn
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera. Works well and takes great pictures.I am somewhat disappointed however that it does not have a rechargeable battery. In defense f the camera howeverthe batteries last much longer than in older cameras. My only complaint.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew Fry "Drew"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and great quality. May not be full-featured enough for a pro or seasoned photographer, but exceeds the needs of most people. Perfect first camera for my wife!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Beth Berra
Reviews.Content: This is the best digital camera I've ever purchased. Easy to use and takes really good pictures.  Would recommend to anyone who wants great shots.

Reviews.Title: Reply
Reviews.Author: nathan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip that I was taking a trip to Kathmandu, Nepal. I got a good chance to really learn how to use it. Great for the mid range and close ups. Has a great zoom!

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: Kristie Rios
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying my Nikon. It was a good price and works really well. It is easy to use & lightweight & takes awesome quality pics.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera with outstanding features
Reviews.Author: Jaxon
Reviews.Content: After shopping and examining a variety of cameras of this this type and in this general price range, I found the Coolpix L820 to be just right.  It is light and easy to handle even with one hand.  It's auto-focus function is quick and accurate.  The zoom is terrific and functions smoothly.  There is a terrific suite of photo editing and enhancement tools build into the camera.  The viewing screen is sharp, very "color true", and big enough to allow for a good preview of composed pictures.  There are so many features and capabilities on this camera that it I still haven't exhausted them all.  This is a little bit more camera than a simple point and shoot, but its complexities are easy to master with a little practice and open up many possibilities for creativity.  It's connectivity to other digital devices is good, but requires a cord to transfer pictures from internal memory (which is abundant) or from a memory card which is easy to install or remove.  It would be nice to have wifi/bluetooth connectivity with this camera, but I think that the range of capabilities outweighs this unless you are someone who likes to take a picture and immediately share.  So far, all my results have exceeded expectations and I have enjoyed using the various built-in photo editing tools to make my pictures appear even better.

Reviews.Title: Simple & Clear
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: I am not a techy person and I hate a lot of buttons on my camera.  I take simple pictures for my listings and pictures of my family.  This camera is PERFECT for all of that.  Simple to use.  Simple to handle.  Simple to upload pictures.  My only complaint is the battery life.  In the year I've had this camera I have had to replace the batteries 6 times.  I turn it off immediately after using and don't have it on for long periods when I am using it, so the battery life is a little frustrating but overall it's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: it is very good
Reviews.Author: Daudi Mlengela
Reviews.Content: I chose it because it is 30x zoom and 16 MPI dislike the way they sold it to me, I though they will bring it with charger, memory card and batteries. I thought it was tricky for me to spend more money to make it complete, how can I use it without, memory card, rechargeable batteries and charger itself?

Reviews.Title: nice 4 price
Reviews.Author: DaveintheBurgh
Reviews.Content: Got this fore my sons photography extracarricular activity in H.S.  He took some sweet pictures and I have got some nice shots ofhim on the hockey rink. Great camera for the price

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Stan Jaros
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about purchasing this camera.  Previously owned a similar type camera that I had found a bit bulky.  This Nikon has fit the bill for me.  Doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles, but has enough to satisfy all my photo needs.It delivers a very good quality image, easy to operate, and uses 4-AA batteries.  I recommend purchasing the Ultimate Lithium batteries.  I purchased this camera about a month or so ago, have taken a couple hundred photos and have done a few videos and the batteries are still good.  Yes the Ultimate Lithiums are expensive, but so much easier than having to have a charger etc.I've also gotten a lot of compliments on the looks of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pictures, but the battery drains quit quick.
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: This camera take excellent pictures but the battery drains to quick, will replace them with rechargebles, the 30x zoom does require a steady hand.

Reviews.Title: The camera is good
Reviews.Author: Atanu C.
Reviews.Content: In terms of the picture quality, zoom, looks its all good. The only downside is it needs 4 A2 batteries which makes it little difficult to handle when you travel around. I might have omitted this information while buying it. Had it been a product with lithium batteries, it would have been more suitable. 1 and half * less for the battery, otherwise good value for money.

Reviews.Title: Blurry photos
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: I have very steady hands and about 9 out of every 10 photos I took with this were blurry.  I tried all different types of settings and nothing helped.When I did FINALLY get a photo that wasn't blurry it was always a phenomenal looking shot. However most photos did not turn out well.I returned mine for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Howard "Howard"
Reviews.Content: Seems like a good camera - comes with internal memory and can also accept an SD card.It can record movies, and the file plays readily on the computer without any conversion or special software.Just plug the camera into the computer and open windows explorer to find the files in the camera.What doesn't it have?1. The lens is not threaded for a filter.  I like to add a UV or skylight filter for the sole purpose that in an accident I prefer the cheap filter to scratch instead of the lens.2. No viewfinder.  One watches the LCD display instead.I also like that it a standard tripod can screw into the bottom of this camera.

Reviews.Title: No substitute for more expensive cameras
Reviews.Author: Mark C. Weber "FreqAmznBuyer"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice and the 30x optical zoom is great. The issue that I have is that you cannot adjust the shutter speed and a lot of pictures come out very blurry no matter how hard I try to steady myself. The camera comes with a bunch of preset "scenes" that adjust the settings of the camera for certain situations (outdoors, party, etc.). The only scene that I can take a decent, focused indoor picture with is the "backlighting" scene. Those photos come out nicely, but I wish that I could play around with the settings a little bit more, or take indoor pictures using other preset scenes. I guess I need to by a more expensive camera to have those options. Outdoor photos come out great, though.

Reviews.Title: Not the best for action or sports
Reviews.Author: Carolee Yost
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and takes good clear STILL shots.  Any action shots or sport shots are unfocused.  I have tried many different camera settings and still cannot get a good image.

Reviews.Title: Action Shots Blur even w/ special settings
Reviews.Author: zach
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my fiancée as a Christmas gift. She had been using her smartphone as a camera and moving shots are really blurry. The same blurry motion shots are what I get with this camera. I read all the instructions, and it even has specific settings for motion but they don't really help.  I think it's safe to say that if you want action shot performance, you need to step up and spend the money. This camera takes great still shots and the video works great too.  I'm just saying, do not expect high end performance from a budget priced camera.

Reviews.Title: No Problem
Reviews.Author: vivian
Reviews.Content: It seems to be a good buy ..I have not heard any problems with it so that is always good...

Reviews.Title: satisfied
Reviews.Author: Vikki Greenburg
Reviews.Content: First digital camera. So far the functions are easy for me to understand. Great pictures. And video even in unlit rooms is beyond what I expected. Perfect 1st camera to learn basics on, and enough advanced functions for further "testing and playing". Very satisfied at this point.

Reviews.Title: User friendly
Reviews.Author: FR THOMAS M ROUSE
Reviews.Content: As an amateur photographer, I have been more than satisfied with my Nikon COOLPIX L820. It is very easy to use and also provides a wide range of alternative settings. I find it is comfortable to handle. While traveling, I can readily access my camera because it fits snugly into the carrying case which I bought with the camera. So I can quickly take it out and snap shots as I travel by bus or train. The downloading system allows me to quickly transfer photos from the camera to my computer. Overall, I am very happy with this choice of camera and the price.

Reviews.Title: Pictures don't look as good on computer as they do on the camera's LCD
Reviews.Author: Confused at Work
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from the L320 because needed a camera that would take better action shots at soccer games and CMOS for night shots. I have always been a novice so all I need is an easy point-and-shoot camera with long zoom, takes good pics in the dark, burst for sports, and fast shutter speed. This camera supposedly had all. At first, I was pretty impressed with the quality of pics I took of my son at their school's Christmas concert. I was all the way back but the zoom was so good, it was like taking close-up pics of him & the stage decor. The pics looked sharp and gorgeous on the LCD....until I downloaded the pics on my laptop. What happened to the gorgeous pics? With my 17-inch screen (have new HP laptop), the pics are actually blurry, any little movement turned blurry, and I'm not talking about sports/running/fast action movement, I'm talking about turning head to the side, clapping hands, choreography for a moderate Christmas song (kids are on the bleachers singing). Thought maybe I wasn't holding the camera steady enough, but the entire frame was filled with kids & only 2 or so kids moving would be blurry. It's not my computer because I have other pics downloaded from our broken compact Nikon, Fuji waterproof & Olympus cameras as well.Took the camera on vacation, CMOS is supposed to take bright photos even without flash. Well, we were in a well-lit room (fluorescent), again the pics looked great on the LCD, and again, looked horrible blown up on the computer screen - pics were dark. And same as before, photos of the 6-yr was running around the 13-yr old, the 6-yr old was blurry, like wind moving. I also took pics with our very old Olympus tough camera (had both cameras with me) and there was no blur.PROS:~ good super zoom~ fast shutter~ easy to use, has all the different program settings which is perfect for novices like meCONS:~ pics look nice on LCD but are horrible when downloaded to computer~ flash is too bright most of the time...darkness turns to daylight, literally! (tried to take photo of Christmas tree lit up in the dark, pic looked like I had all lights in the room turned on & drowned the tree lights)~ 4 AA batteries lasted me 2 1/2 days. (All our other cameras came with Li-Ion rechargeables so am shocked how much I'd have to spend unless I buy separate rechargeables)I'm hoping I just got a dud, when I looked at the store, it's the only long zoom camera that had the easy pre-programmed setting so am going to exchange next week and if the replacement does not have the issues I mentioned above, I will revise my ratings.

Reviews.Title: My new vision
Reviews.Author: Vaness Hess
Reviews.Content: First camera I've owned in 50 years - this Nikon COOLPIX is so easy I don't even have to be a genius to take beautiful pictures for my new blog!  Thanks Amazon for providing this item through your system

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: KWM
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a "purse cam" to capture shots when I don't have time to shot with my K-5. A a filmmaker, photographer and documentarian, having a point and shoot is PRICELESSS!! I'm also a photography tour guide and when someone does not have a camera I put this in their hands. The video in this is awesome, I love the 60p option. I got more than my moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Reagan
Reviews.Content: The colors and picture are amazing.  Zoom for a small camera is excellent.  The software to upload pics is fine, but the editing part I little to be desired. All and all for 200.00 you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: It's a great easy-to-use point and shoot camera.
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: I needed a simple to use camera with a lot of zoom to take pictures and videos of a graduation ceremony. I also took the camera on vacation to Hawaii. The pictures are excellent and the video looks absolutely stunning.Cons: If you take pictures in low light conditions without the flash, or videos with a long zoom, the pictures/ videos are blurred. The stabilization in the super easy mode could be better.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Leia Edson "smokeyedson"
Reviews.Content: Everything and more of what I expected of it.  I am fascinated with all that it can do. Love it

Reviews.Title: Camera lacks a viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Max Kandler "Frontier Man"
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize when I ordered this camera that it had no view finder. I take most of my pictures outdoors in bright sunshine. It is nearly impossible to see the image well enough to frame a good picture. I had another Nikon camera in the past that had a viewfinder and it was easier and more pleasant to use.

Reviews.Title: Not for indoor photography or kids
Reviews.Author: Elaine
Reviews.Content: This rated well on Consumer Reports and I was impressed with the zoom options, so I bought it without much other research. However, it did not take good pictures in real life. I am a hobbyist and understand indoor photography is tricky; however, the images were often blurry. Additionally, the flash was very harsh; the flash output cannot be adjusted (lowered) at all. It does not work for us because we often take pictures of kids. I am returning it for another camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ronald K. Deel Jr.
Reviews.Content: My dad asked me to order this camera for my mom for Christmas, she absolutely loved it.  You can take great pictureswith this camera and it has a lot of features like videoing and the 1080 HD resolution.I woul recomend this camera to anyone who doesn't want to break their wallet for a camera.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful photos, amazing zoom, great auto-steady, fast on/off
Reviews.Author: ReToM7 "Patrick"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera after an older point and shoot camera we had broke. We were heading to a safari vacation and I was going prepared with as much photo equipment as possible. We ended up having a GoPro 3+ Silver Edition, my Canon Digital SLR, and this L820. Thank goodness we brought it. The GoPro takes much better quality video, but has no zoom ability. My 55-250mm lens on the Digital SLR broke and left me with only the L820. The pictures came out great from macro to regular to zoomed in. I took a photo of the moon at full zoom, holding it in my hands. The stability control and zoom worked to allow me to see the full moon with great detail of the surface.I know other cameras go beyond 16MP now, but 16 should be more than enough for everyone. I would highly recommend this as a high quality point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, very user friendly!
Reviews.Author: Norman R. Smith
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the performance and features on this camera. The camera was well designed, with ease of operation as an important part of it's layout. The rear mounted control buttons give you immediate access to the ability to control exposure, set the self timer, change from photo to video, or play back your photos. It is possible to set up different shots quickly because of this great layout.  The 30X optical zoom is outstanding, and the image remains extremely good into the digital zoom as well.The video performance is really great, and with stereo audio as well. For the photo enthusiast, this camera should please you. At the price, it would be hard to find a better unit.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera, easy to use, great image quality
Reviews.Author: GJB
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera and it gives great results even if you are not an experienced photographer. The only reason i did not give it a 5-star rating is that the shutter response is a little too slow, the button does not have good sensitivity, and the absence of a remote compromises the steadiness of the shot in low-light conditions or night shots

Reviews.Title: five stars
Reviews.Author: Carrie Lichon
Reviews.Content: Easy To Use.  Amazing How Much You Can Do With it.  Kind Of Overwhelming For A Beginner. Excellent Price though

Reviews.Title: can't rave enough
Reviews.Author: sally
Reviews.Content: This camera makes me look like an amazing photographer. It is easy to use, easy to upload the photos, and very sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera even for point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: bbbbadwizard
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife to replace a smaller and well used Nikon coolpix.  I haveseveral model P510 units and this camera is very similar.  My wife loves itfor ebay pics and around the house

Reviews.Title: Handy
Reviews.Author: G Naoma R "Noma"
Reviews.Content: Definitely not "top of the line" but a great little digital camera, none-the-less!  It takes beautiful photos at a decent resolution so larger sized prints should be fairly good quality.  It's pretty strait forward to use, I didn't even read the booklet and I've managed to figure out the features in one or two uses.  Dropping the photos onto my computer was super easy too.  Over all, for a hobbyist photographer on a budget, it's a pretty good camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Ct
Reviews.Content: Easy to use camera with great zoom capabilities. Clear pictures every time. Love that it does video also. Great price too.

Reviews.Title: Best Affordable ultra zoom on Market today!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Hassan  Abdellkader
Reviews.Content: As expected, light camera, with features and price it competes directly to Canon SX500IS, and Sony H200. The 30X optical zoom delivers nice optical quality. only downsides are image quality at higher ISO settings.

Reviews.Title: excellent zoom, good value for the price
Reviews.Author: N. Wootton "Amaryllis"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband. He has enjoyed it thus far. He particularly likes the clear pictures he is getting with the zoom feature. I don't think I'd want a camera this large to lug around, but he is doesn't mind. I have to admit it does take much better pictures than my little old Polaroid digital.

Reviews.Title: Good deal.
Reviews.Author: MH
Reviews.Content: Cool "pre-DSLR" camera for beginners just getting into photography.  Lots of features to play around with before you drop the big bucks on a nice DSLR.  Also, takes excellent pictures for a sub $200 point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Gregory Thompson
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera. It is not a DLSR. It is not supposed to be. In its price range I believe it is the best camera you can find. The camera is absolutely great outdoors. Indoors, it does as good a job as you can expect without a flash, in its price range. For indoor shots without the flash, make sure your hand is steady before clicking the button and you will get a clear well lit shot under most average conditions. I recommend It!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: dia daze "dia daze"
Reviews.Content: its a nikon, what needs to be said? The pics are perfection crisp and beautiful, I got tired of using my galaxy S4 for pics and videos, I wanted something that would capture more beauty, this cam does it and then some, it is the very best bang for your buck i am so glad i bought it

Reviews.Title: Great bridge camera!
Reviews.Author: margaret cermak
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Easy to use.  Great zoom.  I'm a novice and took great pictures with this camera the first time.  Still learning all the features, but would not trade.  This was recommended by a friend who is an amateur photographer.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and takes great still pictures.  The zoom is really good, allowing to get great shots at a distance.  My main issue with this camera, as others have stated, is taking shots with any bit if motion at all.  They always turn our blurry, even with the least bit of movement.  I have tried multiple settings, including the sports setting, and also tried changing ISO, but not much difference.  I would not recommend this camera for general purpose, if you only plan to take scenery and still shots then it will be fine.

Reviews.Title: Amazing.
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing for the pricePros:30X ZOOM!Great quality for the priceGood UICons:None!One issue I did have was it said, "Battery Exhausted" but using Duracell batteries fixed it. I was using crappy dollar general batteries before.

Reviews.Title: Zoom Capability of COOLPIX L820
Reviews.Author: Herb Hutchinson
Reviews.Content: Primarily for the 30X Wide Zoom Lens capability. It takes incredibly sharp photos of objects over 100 feet distance, and magnificent photos of the Moon's surface.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for us
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S "Jennifer S"
Reviews.Content: great camera - completely meets our needs.  Purchased as present for my daughter's birthday & she loves it.  She is still learning all the features & functions, but has used it so far to take great sports pics & low-light pics.  high expectations as she continues to explore the capabilities.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy Bybee "Cindy Bybee"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is easy to use and fairly small for how much it has to offer.  I love the fact that you can download pics to your computer so easy.  I sell on ebay a lot and use my camera often.  The only gripe I have is that when using the option for it to self adjust it will pic things that make no sense.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: tim overland
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my girlfriend for her birthday to use on her trip to Hawaii.I researched all brands and read a lot of feedback and this seemed to be the best for the point and shoots. She called today to let me know just how awesome it is and she gave it a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, variety of settings, great photos!
Reviews.Author: Rdanyc83
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a trip to Europe based on the amazon reviews, and it did not disappoint. For the price, this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Jonas
Reviews.Content: We have bought this camera for vacation but have testing it out in different scenaios, I love it, the zoom, how you can crop the pictures

Reviews.Title: upgrading to this camera...
Reviews.Author: CheeseHead
Reviews.Content: First thing is the color; it's really sharp looking, it's a patent red or wine w/black ...very nice!Second is of course the range of zoom = 30x.Third is that you can take pictures in 'any' lighting or 'any' time of day.The rest are just as amazing features like; clarity, 3" screen, large hand grip for holding the camera & many,many other features.It's just a great camera.Oh I forgot, it runs on batteries. (You don't have to charge it!!!)

Reviews.Title: Very Easy to Operate!
Reviews.Author: D. Sommers "wwwshopper"
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera pro, so I needed an easy-to-operate camera.  The start-up instructions were very easy to understand and the pictures are great.  Surprised to see it came with a lens cover, strap, video cables, and USB cable.  I did not read that on the site.  I highly recommend this great point-and-shoot camera for anyone.

Reviews.Title: A beautiful camera
Reviews.Author: M. Matthews
Reviews.Content: I ordered a red one and I love it!  The camera is easy to use, focuses almost instantly, and I particularly like the flash set up.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera - Great Price
Reviews.Author: M. Levine
Reviews.Content: I think the COOLPIX L820 is by far one of the best in this category. The COOLPIX L820 is easy to use/operate and it just simply takes great pictures and video. This is the only camera I own and I use it everyday. The only down-side in my opinion is the batteries. Gone are the flat, rectangle rechargeable batteries (needing only one) to 4 x AA. I change batteries frequently.

Reviews.Title: IN LOVE!!
Reviews.Author: Michaela Haas
Reviews.Content: This was the first camera I ever bought for myself that wasn't off the shelf from walmart. I'm a bit of a photo junkie so this camera has all the features I could ever want and more.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Arun Arya
Reviews.Content: This camera is one of the best in the price range. I would recommend it to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product with a specific purpose in mind: to take my friend hiking up Diamond Head Crater in Hawaii. It went above and beyond my expectations! The 30x zoom was amazing! I took so many photos from closeup shots on sea turtles to zoomed in all the way shots. All photos were so vibrant and beautiful! I have had Nikon cameras in the past but this by far is your best ever! Loved it! I can't wait to go touring castles in Europe!

Reviews.Title: Great pics, solved battery issue.
Reviews.Author: Greg F. Van Heel "Greg"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes excellent photos and has lots of settings to compensate for lighting conditions.I had a battery problem shortly after using it. I took a few dozen photos and after uploading them to the computer the camera wouldn't turn back on - it said " battery exhausted " and wouldn't do anything. I thought, well...I guess this thing really eats batteries. It turns out that if you have it connected to your computer and turn it on to upload, then you must TURN IT OFF before disconnecting the cord. Otherwise it gives you the battery error message and you're stuck. You can reset it by opening the battery case and taking one of them out for about 5 seconds.Also, I saw another reviewer complained that you can't view pictures without the lens being out - that's wrong, you just have to hold down the play button for a few secs and then you can view your pics.Overall, I'm very happy with the camera and it takes great photos and it easy to use.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I stalked this camera, literally, stalked, looking at different retailers. I bit the bullet and purchased it on Amazon. I absolutely love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: emong
Reviews.Content: It does everything I need it to do so far. It could use some improvement in these areas:1. use the flat square type batteries instead of 4 double As. The ones that it came with exhausted after about 150 shots and frequent playback2. The continuous sports mode should be faster. I saw a lot of blur on the motion shots.3. The LCD should allow tilt and foldBeing a novice, I don't mind not having manual mode. It takes good pictures  with very little effort.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Kimberly K Crider
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera! I am not a camera buff by any means, although I have fooled around with DSLRs and was considering one in the future... However, this camera fits the bill since I starting to realize that I don't have the time or the motivation to go that much deeper into the science of photography. This camera goes above and beyond what one would expect for the price. I'm really really pleased, and having a great time experimenting with it. Can't go wrong if you want a little more than a traditional, tiny, point and shoot...

Reviews.Title: WOW!!! What incredible long distance video capability!
Reviews.Author: Alexander Itsekson "reading tech"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to be able to tape my kid singing the national anthem at a huge stadium. i was seated in the nose bleed section, from our seats we could see the boys on the field, but they were like tiny bugs on the field.  We zoomed in and could clearly and easily identify our child from the rest, all of the faces were clear. It was truly amazing. when i zoomed out at the end and showed the size of the stadium and the distance from which we were video taping it, people watching the video were astounded. Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!! Can't believe the price for the quality!
Reviews.Author: CELENA  R  POPE
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera! Can't believe it's this cheap! Used it at Jay Z and Justin Timberlake concert a couple months ago at outdoor arena in Baltimore and cannot believe the detail quality I got from where we were! If you take bad photos with this camera then you don't know how yo use it. It's not a point and shoot, learn how to change settings to fit what you're shooting. I have owned several cameras and have a canon rebel and this camera is nearly as awesome in a compact size I can take into events! You'll be glad you got this camera! After a 2 hour concert doing videos and pics my batteries still had a lot of life left. Very very happy I went with this after much shopping and comparing.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera, still discovering features
Reviews.Author: randy
Reviews.Content: Like camera very much (more like 4 1/2 stars). Pictures have been very good, some excellent. Wish it had more manual control for some settings, especially shutter speed. Zoom is great, good detail.

Reviews.Title: Wow! Exactly what I wanted for the price
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I will update as I test through the features. I wish I could upload sample photos. I was amazed as I stood in my master bath and zoomed across the bathroom, out the door of the adjoining master bedroom, out THAT door and into the upstairs open hallway and THEN through THAT door at the end of the hall to the furthest room on the floor (none of the rooms had any lights turned on, only overcast hazy natural light). I took a photo of the room at the other end of the house and the photo picked up the details of the FIBERS in the decorative floor carpet!!!  Blew me away.  Without flash!!  My last Sony would have choked on such a feat and it cost about 100 more.  Overall, quite pleased with the low-light features. Camera pops on and ready to shoot in quite good timing. That was my first concern as that was always a benefit of Sony -- the ability to see a random photo opp, grab the camera, turn it on and shoot immediately.  Canon chokes on that, so do a few others.  Sony DSC is master there, but this Nikon is quite impressive point-n-shoot ready.  And it's low-light is far superior to my Sony. I have two cameras with all the bells and whistles, because I thought *someday* I may finally learn how to use them. But to this day, they remain virtually untouched.  I finally got smart and got a camera that really has the very best of ONLY those features I need the most!Also - must say that the product picture does not do this camera justice in terms of color.  This photo makes it look like something a teenage girl would have in their locker. In reality, the camera is a stunning deep dark garnet red - very handsome!!! Very serious and posh looking. No more picking up the wrong camera from table at weddings!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kiker
Reviews.Content: I have always used a Nikon camera, clear back to the 35MM with the small EM.  I wanted a good quality, point and shoot for a vacation to Gdansk Poland.  This camera perfomed flawlessly and captured the beautiful sites, even at a long distance.  For the price this is an awesome camera.  Probably will only use this and not it's big brother.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: quilter
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera, Easy to use ,easy focus just really love the camera I also purchased a camaera case from Amazon and it is just perfect!

Reviews.Title: Two thumbs up
Reviews.Author: Kp
Reviews.Content: Better camera that I was expecting. Bought it for a family vacation and the pics are absolutely stunning. I wasn't ready to buy an SLR but this worked beyond my wildest dreams.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera for the $$
Reviews.Author: sarah
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a started camera for my 12 yr old daughter.  She loves it!! It's very easy to use and has some really neat features and an amazing zoom.

Reviews.Title: Takes great photos, and that's all that matters, right?
Reviews.Author: Shevi "FantasyWeaver"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great photos easily, and that's the only thing I care about. I love that you get a lens that can take wide-angle photos as well as zoom in really close. A fellow reviewer recommended it to me, and I'm so glad he did. This is just the right bridge camera for someone who would love to own a DSLR but can't afford one, like me.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I've had
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a couple of months ago and it was a slight upgrade from my L-810. Both these Nikon cameras are the only ones I've been able to get good (great) moon pictures with and are excellent on low light pictures. As far as I'm concerned, this was actually an upgrade from my Nikon D-7000 DSLR and is much more user friendly. Disregard all the complaints about the lens cap being attached to the camera body and lack of a viewfinder,just buy this camera, learn how to use it (easy) and enjoy the heck out of it!  Erik M.

Reviews.Title: The photos are brilliant compared to what I can capture with my iPhone
Reviews.Author: Stephen Chen
Reviews.Content: Nikon has created a camera that does it all!  An HD video recorder (1080p), a very high resolution still camera, and loads of features for easy downloads and creating error-free shots (e.g. eliminate red-eye, an incredible 30X zoom).  Priced under $200, the cost benefit is very high.  I was incented to purchase this camera when my sister showed it off in a recent trip.  Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Not a pro but sometimes this helps me look like one
Reviews.Author: Jan H
Reviews.Content: I got this larger Coolpix after getting the little one a few years back.  Its just as easy to use and comes in the same color of red like I like.  I don't know how to use all the features yet but have been getting some great results just playing around with it.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, and great features
Reviews.Author: Donald D. Missig
Reviews.Content: Simple and easy to use, and take great pictures. Best feature is you can take indoor pictures with out a flash.

Reviews.Title: Loving this camera
Reviews.Author: Snowy Marigold
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace an older Canon. It was definitely the right choice. I did a special scrapbooking project over a weeks time, taking over 700 photos and the camera really performed well (on one set of batteries, nonetheless). Pictures are crisp and clear even in lower light situations, both indoors and outdoors. The zoom allowed me to get excellent close-ups from a distance without the blur I would get from my old Canon. The macro feature allows amazing close-ups. I'm more than satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Tammy Robertson "Stellar Essence"
Reviews.Content: Small enough to carry in a purse for quick pics, yet professionalenough to take amazing photos. Very comfortable to hold in hand.This makes a great second camera if you have a larger heavier version.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera
Reviews.Author: LeMyra Mace
Reviews.Content: I like that it is light and easy to use. I don't have to change lenses to get close up photos

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jason Eve
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get a good camera for to take pictures of our first baby...This camera exceeded my expectations. The camera also takes video and it turns out great.

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality
Reviews.Author: Fadalo
Reviews.Content: The picture taken from this camera are so much better than other cameras I had before. The 30x zoom function is one of the reason I bought this camera.

Reviews.Title: Superb for the price!
Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: I've had other cameras in the mid-price range, and I have to admit that this camera outstanded my expectations. It takes crisp and rich-colored pictures with very low light conditions and relatively fast (that is, if you have at least 1/3 of a second for it to adapt to the light pressing softly the button). Pictures are taken relatively quickly and the built-in features (although all automatic) are very precise.Besides a panorama mode that can take 180º or 360º photos very easily (you decide), it has a very interesting mode (the "pet" mode) that lets you take a sequence of photos (about 3 per second in any resolution) and does a pretty good job in focusing the target (of course, it depends on the previous automatic adjustment of about a third of a second and how quick the target moves, or else it will be blurry).It's true about the lens cap... it's a minor issue if you don't have the precaution to take it off previous powering it on. The camera pops out its lens at power up and the cap doesn't just come off... it has a snap-on configuration that blocks the lens, so I don't know if this can damage the motor of the zoom-autofocus feature someday, but I guess that's something you have to get used to do before using the camera.Zooming is very nice (although the 30x isn't completely physical... the last third of the zooming is digital) and macro photos are also cute.The easy video feature (it can record up to 1080p with stereo sound) is also a plus on this camera. No selecting between modes, since they are independent with different buttons. Just take a picture, press the video button to record and pause-stop, and take another picture again. Really cool.Overall, it's an excellent camera for photo enthusiasts like myself without the hassle and price of more professional ones. I strongly reccomend it if you like to take photos of just about anything.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Bridge Cam
Reviews.Author: Jacquomo
Reviews.Content: This cam is perfect in photos and videos. Small problems in auto focusing in video shooting but still excellent quality with affordable price

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Chiang shang jung
Reviews.Content: it is very convenient . You can take a lot of good pictures.SO I think it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Great product !
Reviews.Author: matachang
Reviews.Content: Excellent, brilliant, easy to use... Simply, i'm not a "professional", but i can do more than i was supposed to be able to... with it !I'm simply... i do not know how to tell all my satisfaction :)To be recommend for a novice... and professional :)

Reviews.Title: easy to grab and hold
Reviews.Author: Randall Ray "Randy"
Reviews.Content: I was getting tired of the little boxy shirt pocket type of camera and when I saw this one, it caught my eyes.  Upon first picking it up and looking it over in the store, I was impressed with the ease of operation.  Having owned and still own a Pentax ME Super, I find this camera to be of better quality and much better ease of use than the P & S one that I have kind of put in the shade for now.  They both have little idiosyncrasy's, as far as what works for you and what doesn't.  I am finding out that they all have the A and P settings and each has a little glitch, if you will, of what that entails.  I don't have any drawbacks on this L820. I have a little hard time with the battery cover, in that it takes a little extra effort to get the cover lock, in just the right place for it to pop open.  I'm afraid it will eventually snap off.  I love the fact that I don't have to worry about getting those high priced square boxed little battery's and now I just go and get 4 AA's.  Of course I get the best and don't skimp on that.  I haven't used the video transfer function yet, but hopefully in the near future.  Close ups seem to be a problem for me, in that it has two places for zoom control.  The one associated with the snap button, and the one on the lens. But as with time and practice and patience, I will learn.  I would think that including a dvd of how to use some features would be a great boon to some of us.  The usual features of a P & S camera are standard.  I haven't come across anything unusual as of yet, in as some tricks of the trade, but maybe down the line someone will.  For under $200 this is a great camera.  I do wish the lenses were interchangeable.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera with awesome zoom
Reviews.Author: jeffrey boyd
Reviews.Content: i had a basic ole $90 Kodak camera from walmart for years. it was getting to the end of its life and I was looking for a better camera with better zoom. the Kodak only had 5x optical zoom. this Nikon has 30x optical zoom! it is an amazing camera and is super user friendly. it has an easy mode to where you just point and shoot and the camera does the rest. all you have to do is zoom in to what you are wanting to take a picture of. the camera takes care of flash, color, blurriness, etc. this camera is great for sports and movement. I actually have taken to a NASCAR event and the pictures turned out awesome even at speeds over 100mph.  this is by far the best camera for the money you put in it. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Recommend this camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: This camera is small, easy to use, has a great zoom lens and the price is awesome.  I am a casual photographer and would recommend this camera.  I have owned Nikon cameras for many years and find them very reliable.

Reviews.Title: worked great!!!
Reviews.Author: Harley Dude "Harley dude"
Reviews.Content: took it on a 4200 mile bike trip. compact with a great zoom lens. got great pictures. I Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great pics on the trip
Reviews.Author: Dale French
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of price, name and digital zoom, as well as the reviews I read. Just a few days before a major trip, I received it and began learning how to use it. It was a great tool and I took over 2500 pics!!! I am still going through them to delete the ones that did not turn out so well, but I continue to use it in so many different ways.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Stuart Chas Lokich
Reviews.Content: This camera is very versatile and takes remarkable pictures easily on automatic settings.  I've barely cracked the surface of everything it can do but I have tried the special effects and they are impressive.  I use the 8 mpxl setting and have found it to be more than adequate for photo-shop and e-mailing.  Camera has everything you need to begin immediately and I took several difficult night shots with street lamps in the background and no question, this is a terrific CMOS sensor. Went to a Bar-B-Que and found the camera takes all kinds of lighting shots and the colors are vivid.  By the way, the "red" body drew attention for being very up-to-date.  The only issue is the dreaded lens cap problem where-in the cap sits on the body and snaps in.  While secure, it must be removed before operating the camera or the lens telescopes into it upon operation and could jam eventually.  All-in-all, I expect years of great photos and good memories with this Nikon.  I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a better quality automatic point and shoot in an SLR format.

Reviews.Title: nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: RL
Reviews.Content: i like the nice size of the viewer screen. its very clear and bright. I havent taken very many pictures yet with it but they look nice for what i have taken. came with photo editing software and the maunual for the camera both on cds. has many "scene" icons to use for different situations. like low light or action, etc. good camera so far.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Julia Schechter
Reviews.Content: Bought it before I went to live in Spain for the summer and it's been incredible! Took wonderful and clear pictures. Only comment is that the lens cap keeps falling off.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Sheila-Andy
Reviews.Content: Best camera I have ever bought. Easy to use and my husband loves the panoramic setting. Pictures come out amazing and the zoom is great for long distances shots. Can't wait for our next vacation to use the camera again.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Kendra Trahan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for a trip I am taking for 6 days to Tokyo during Thanksgiving week. I have not gone on the trip yet, but have used the camera extensively to get used to it, etc. I read some of the negative reviews on here and not one of them have been true to me. I have had absolutely NO problem hooking the camera up to my computer for one. It's extremely easy to get my pictures off the camera.Second, the lens cap issue is not an issue. If you leave the cap on and turn on the camera, it simply flashes a white screen saying "lens error." All you have to do is turn it back off, take the lens cap off, turn it back on and you're good to go. I haven't had any grunting noises or trouble or anything and I have forgotten the lens cap on a few times.I DO struggle to get clear pictures when lots of movement is involved although I'm still playing with the settings. I don't think the blurriness is a problem of the camera so much as it is the settings or the user.This is the PERFECT camera for people who are not professionals but want some good looking pictures. The zoom is amazing and the focus is as well. I find it very user friendly for people who know their way around a point and shoot camera. If you don't know your way around cameras, there is an auto option.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Images
Reviews.Author: DNASCT
Reviews.Content: I would say 1 out of 5 images was in focus. While taking a simple picture of my daughter eating her first solids her hands would move and they would be a blurred streak in the pictures. This was on automatic mode. The next day  I took the camera to my son's Soccer game and put it on sports mode and most of the images were blurry again. If you have kids that will sit still and smile then this camera would be great. My kids are always on the go and therefor most of my pics were blurry. There is no way to adjust the shutter speed so it will capture the pic quicker to avoid the blur. I returned this camera.

Reviews.Title: It didn't work
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: The video portion of this camera didn't work and caused the camera to freeze up and become non operational. Under warranty I sent it to Nikon and the replaced a chip or board that was causing the malfunction. Got the camera back and it seems to work fine now.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality!
Reviews.Author: C. Scott "b&dsmom;"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in preparation for a trip to Alaska.  I wanted to be able to zoom in and take better quality photos that a simple point and shoot. I also did not want to bring my SLR, simply b/c of the bulk.  I have been testing this out at swim meets and soccer games, and am shocked that in many instances that quality is as good or better than my SLR.  I have played with the settings, and am looking forward to getting great glacier and family shots on our trip next month.

Reviews.Title: Slow to process pictures
Reviews.Author: well hi there
Reviews.Content: PROS:Overall quality of camera structure is 5 stars. Very well made.Camera has a nice weight & feel to it.Large display is excellent for viewing/editing pictures (although editing is unlikely)Quality of the pictures taken, if you can compensate for the serious lag in between photos, can be excellent.CONS:Very slow processing time between pictures!!!! - absolutely frustrating and unacceptable. I cannot stress this enough. I could take pictures with a 35mm faster. B/c of lag time between taking pictures, it makes it difficult to catch crucial moments especially objects or, more importantly, people in action.Camera lens cover attaches to the body and not the lens itself. If you push the power button with the lens cap on, the lens with push on the cap causing stress and possible failure. Poor, thoughtless, consumer design.Micro feature on this model is useless. Unless you have excellent lighting, the images always turn out dark. I have owned older digital consumer Canon models which are much more effect and useful than this Nikon.Zooming in/out is mediocre & slow.Previewing photos taken on the screen is very difficult in bright lighting, such as outdoors in the sunlight. But this is common among digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L820
Reviews.Author: capceltic "Capceltic"
Reviews.Content: This is a great digital camera for the price. The pictures are crystal clear and the zoom is impressive. Lots of features at your finger tips that you can get quickly while your shooting.The only cons I have is the lack of a view finder so it's difficult to see what your shooting at during a bright sunny day. The screen size is nice but does not pivot. Which is part of the problem. But again, for the price, this camera is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: cant zoom and do close ups
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: its a 'nice' camera except when you zoom in its all blurry, you cant get a clear picture at all if its zoomed in. and you can't do close ups with this camera at all. all the pictures are blurry unless its steady on a tripod or table. my samsung galaxy s3 takes waaaay better photos. its the same as any other point and shoot digital camera except designed to look like a nikon dslr. not worth $200. and if you forget to take the lens cap off your camera will break. i suggest either buying a cheaper regular digital camera or an expensive photography dslr camera.

Reviews.Title: Not suitable for the environment you would actually use it in
Reviews.Author: Merennulli
Reviews.Content: Many features on this camera are extremely good. The zoom is smooth, the controls are laid out well for easy access without looking at them, and if you don't look at the mislabeled directional button, the settings of the camera are extremely intuitive. It uses standard AA batteries, which are a costly option, but also mean that you can simply dump them out and put new in rather than waiting for it to charge - often critical, especially on vacations.But this is a point and shoot. If you are looking at point and shoot, you are most likely wanting to take pictures of the real world where you wait for the sunlight to be right, or you get children to hold still, or many other things that require the shot to be quick after you press the button. That's why you even have auto-focus, so you're not sitting there focusing.If you use the auto-focus, though, it will get blurry, then crisp, then blurry, then crisp, then wobble a bit, then get blurry and crisp again. If there's any light issue, it will also swing between light and dark between each blurry and crisp cycle. Then, several moments after pressing the button, it takes the picture, and most often after selecting one of the blurry, too dark, or washed out version rather than the perfectly crisp and well lighted option it seemed to have settled on just before. If you're trying to take family photos, such as Christmas morning, or taking nature photos where the sun has to shine through a break in the clouds, this lengthy delay means you missed your shot, even if you're lucky enough to have the auto-focus pick the right focus.Taking the auto-focus off for things like indoor macro shots or cooperative adults produced excellent images after a little tweaking. But the failure of auto-focus on a camera like this is like having a hammer that is great on everything except nails.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Gary L Andersen
Reviews.Content: I just got this around Thanksgiving time and wish I would have saved my money to for a DSLR instead. This camera doesn't auto focus about half the time. It won't auto flash about half the time and the picture is too dark to see clearly.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L820
Reviews.Author: Jled 2013 "jgtr"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in on October 9, 2013 from Amazon. I received it on Oct. 15. I really like the pictures it takes and the camera in red.I thought it was great for the money.  I think it takes very good pictures in low light.However, I am having a problem with the "Movie Mode".  Every other time when I go to "Movie Mode" it locks up and no buttons work.  The display still shows, but I have to open the battery cover and reset the camera. Sometimes it will record the full 29 minutes of video.  Then if I try it again, the camera will freeze up at 28min. and 53 seconds.  So it looks like there was 7 seconds of record time.  But it doesn't record anything.It allows 29 minutes of video at a time.  It counts down from 29 minutes. So at 28min. and 53 seconds it locks up. Every time it does this, I have to open the battery cover to reset the camera.  Then it may work, or may not work in "Movie Mode".Nikon said that since I initially used a "Nikon non recommended" SD card , the Transcend Class 10 32GB 18 MB/s, (The Transcend card was featured on Amazon as recommended to buy with the camera, so I bought it),  that I needed to get one of the 4 cards on their list of approved SD cards, one of which is Sandisk.So I bought a Sandisk High speed 32GB 45MB/s card from Amazon and I received it today very quickly.  It still does the same thing.  I recorded a video, stopped, and then tried it again and the camera locks up at 28 minutes and 53 seconds left to record and needs to be reset by opening the battery compartment.Nikon told me today after I received a supposedly "Approved Card" from Sandisk,,,,  that I damaged the camera by using the Transcend card in the first place.Again, The Transcend card was featured on Amazon as recommended to buy with the camera,so I bought it.Nikon says I have to return the camera to them for repair.  What kind of BS is this?My fear is that they will try to charge me for something that I should never have caused a problem in the first place.I suppose I have been lucky, but, I have never had this kind of problem before with products that I have bought from reputable companies.I did not!! think I would get a problem like this from Nikon.I wish Amazon would take it back.  They have been so good.I see several other reputable Vendors that recommend Transcend SD cards and also some other brands that are not on Nikons list as well with this camera.Has anyone else had this problem?  I am not happy!!  I don't want to send it to Nikon before Xmas.I see several other reputable Vendors that recommend Transcend SD cards and also some other brands that are not on Nikons list as well for this camera.UPDATE 5/1/2014:I sent the Red camera back to Nikon NY.  They didn't do anything to address the freeze up in Movie mode. They said that they cleaned things and sent it back to me.  It locked up the second time I tried movie mode. Now I am really pissed.Meanwhile, I bought a "refurbished" Plum camera from Adorama and a new Sandisk class 10 SD card.  It works perfectly with all the SD cards that I have.  No lock up which requires the battery compartment to be opened to reset the camera.So I went back to Nikon and they had me send it to Precision camera in Connecticut.  I also sent the new SD card and batteries.After being "In repair" for a week,  they sent it back to me saying they they cleaned all contacts, Complete Repair and return all functions to factory specs, Firmware download, corrections and adjustments, Address values and adjusted.Nothing about the Movie Mode issue.The camera froze up the second time I tried Movie mode.  I guess they just threw away the letter I included describing the PROBLEM!!I CAN NOT BELIEVE THIS CRAP FROM NIKON!At least they didn't lose my SD card and batteries.The camera froze up on the second try at "movie mode".  After 7 seconds the camera freezes up, and I have to reboot by opening the batter compartment.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: grace
Reviews.Content: It is an awesome camera and it takes great photos! And I could not have asked for a better deal.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a good price!
Reviews.Author: Aj N
Reviews.Content: PROS: The 30x zoom is impressive & since it uses 4 AA batteries things become easier not having to worry abt batteries as much. Picture clarity is great & camera features are sufficient for every scene.CONS: There is no EVF (electronic view finder) so you rely on the lcd screen. There is no manual mode so people who want to customize focus, aperture etc shouldnt buy this. However there are several features to compensate for this.I'm loving this every moment of my use and it does take clear pictures to live upto the Nikon brand.

Reviews.Title: Liked it
Reviews.Author: Paul Weinberg
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a present for my wife. She is thrilled with the features and ease of use and the quality of the photos

Reviews.Title: nice step up for better low light shots
Reviews.Author: Janice Brooks
Reviews.Content: meets my needs for better shots at live shows and in low light. Looking forward to working more with the video features

Reviews.Title: Great purchase, very satisfied
Reviews.Author: T'essel
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. To learn settings, just play around with it BEFORE taking it somewhere. Sometimes auto is better and sometimes it isn't, depends on lighting, situation, etc. The pictures are very clear and crisp, the telephoto is excellent.  My favorite is the color select. The sound when played back on my laptop is very good. If you want a better camera, you will have to pay more, but I don't know why this one wouldn't suffice for someone who isn't a pro or an aspiring pro. A lot in this camera for the price. I like it lots better than my point and shoot Kodak. That one seemed to always want to give me fuzzy pictures, no matter what setting I used.

Reviews.Title: Not good for outdoor photgograpy.
Reviews.Author: AbqJerry
Reviews.Content: The LCD is almost impossible to see if you are in the sun and without an optical viewfinder is therefore pretty much useless for taking pictures of outdoor scenery.  I sometimes take 200 pictures daily when on vacation and like to know what I'm getting. The picture quality is generally good and the macro setting seems to work quite well. I returned the camera for a refund due to the LCD issue.

Reviews.Title: Quite good :-S
Reviews.Author: PaulMW
Reviews.Content: Would give it 3.5 stars if that were possible!It seems to be a good little camera with very good design/ergonomics and with a quite impressive zoom lens.But, and this is my entirely own fault/lackofresearch - after buying it "on impulse" :-S, it seems to be a little short on all the manual adjustments that I've grown used to having on my cameras over the years - eg apparently no availability of the RAW function or the various PASM setting modes etc.However most of its "default settings" are what my previous prosumer digicam (a Panasonic FZ20) has wound up with, so I can live with it/them - as I will now have to do :-S :-).After a few days playing around with it I suspect that its shake reduction technology may not be quite as good as the Panasonic's image stabilizing system, which works very well.Can't yet rate its movie function which, on paper at least, seems to be very adequate/impressive - haven't yet gotten used to the idea of using the one camera for both photos and movies!I do value the fact, and it was one of the reasons I bought it, that the L820 uses 4xAAs rather than the much more expensive proprietary sort of battery that the FZ20, and many other digicams, seem to use - bearing in mind that, since they draw such a lot of power, one must carry a spare battery with any digicam.And it also has a much more useful ISO range then the FZ20's 400max - going up to 3200 - which is important with the f3-ish lens that digicams all seem to have. A pity that it won't take the f1.2 lens from my 35mm film Nikons :-DSo: reasonable value/money for what is basically a "point-and-shoot" camera - but a slightly costly lesson for me: I should have thought a little more about what I wanted/expected before clicking "Buy Now"!

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Romeu Hilgenstieler
Reviews.Content: Have been taking pictures for over 30 years and have been pleasantly surprised by this camera. Excellent wide angle (able to include everyone in the shot, and more importantly, able to shoot in tight environments). Low-light is amazing. Good size and feel. If I were to nitpick, would mention that the multi-function button is a bit too small for my fingers.  Sometimes want to hit "OK" and hit one of the direction buttons.  But I imagine that it is only a matter of getting used to the new camera.  The other minor thing is that the memory card is in the same compartment as the batteries and you need to close it again, remove the batteries or hold the camera upside down while changing the card. Would be better if the compartment door were a bit sturdier. The color selector is really cool.  Using it much more than had expected.Great camera, even more so when considering the price.Have taken over 600 pictures and about 20 minutes HD video over the last 10 days with a single charge of Sony rechargeable batteries. The batteries are still in the camera and with power. Could never get that from a proprietary battery!Even more impressed with the low-light capabilities and overall picture and video quality. Recommend this to anyone who wants a very good camera at an excellent price.

I was very wary of moving to a bigger camera, especially since I'm not very good with figuring out settings and features. I like to keep things simple and the Nikon L 820 does all of that. I am easily able to go through the different shooting modes and get back to auto without having any problems. The camera adjusts for the lighting that you are in. For example we were in a dark theater and the camera went to night mode, the pictures came out great. The camera is small enough that you can put it in a purse or diaper bag without it taking up too much space or weighing you down. I was worried about the battery life because I'm not used to having to change batteries in my camera but I've had this camera for a month and so far the batteries are still good. I'm not sure how many pictures I've taken but I've been to a few amusement parks and I covered a children's program for work and they are still going strong. I believe this is the perfect camera for a beginner or for anyone looking for a great camera at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: On The Nikon L820 Camera-Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Good Consumer
Reviews.Content: This camera is a pleasure to use.  It is intuitive and well laid out.  It's purpose is to be an automatic camera that takes great photos quickly and easily, in most situations.It's not for professional photographers by any means, but as a practical tool for general business and life, and for taking excellent photos quickly - it is unbeatable in this price range, as of this writing.  The 30x optical zoom is definitely cool and useful (yes, there are cameras with more zoom but this is plenty for many situations).  The lens can focus extremely close on zoom even from a working space distance away from the object (there are settings to monitor this on the view screen-see Using Macro Mode in manual).  I love this camera's ability to take close ups - close enough for most needs, after all, it's not a microscope.The lens movement is smooth (motor action) and has a great quality feel (all focusing is automatic; there is no manual focusing).  The auto focus is fast and sure.  Pictures snap quickly.  This camera has several continuous multi-shot shooting settings.  The L820 has plenty of scene shooting modes (e.g. night portrait, night landscape, snow) that are selected through the on-screen menu (not a touch screen menu).  The macro mode can be activated through a dedicated button that takes you to an On-Off screen that you have to select (by button presses) to enter the macro mode.  Again, the camera is intuitive, though reading the manual definitely helps to learn the camera's operation, the extent of options, and the limitations (such as which functions cannot be used simultaneously).This 16MP camera takes excellent photos; clear, sharp, and with good color.  I have absolutely no complaints about the picture quality.  (Note:  I don't have any complaints about this camera at all.)The thing I like most about the camera is the view screen; a small clear TV screen with plenty of on-screen data.  High sunlight does wash out the image so there are times you may have to cover the screen with your hand.  However, I should also note that I find this camera very easy to handle and manipulate.  It is comfortable.  (I use a small binder clip to help keep the lens cap attached to the camera strap and out of the way of the lens when taking pictures.)  One more thing about this TV screen: it does not articulate - it's a flat screen and does not open to give you flexibility in easy viewing when the positioning of the camera (to get the shot) is contorting or won't allow for direct visual contact (such as when holding the camera above your head with arm extended, in a crowd).  Personally, I can live with that, or rather, without it.Other points: At first glance, this camera has that Nikon professional look (like yeah, I watch NCIS - and those of you who watch also, know what I mean).  The L820 has the same Nikon QUALITY.  But, save for some shooting options, it is automatic and does not provide much in manual settings.  I say 'so what.'  The automatic focusing is extremely good, if not excellent.  Photos are spectacular for most people's needs.  And I would ask, 'exactly how much better can one do, in making the perfect setting, than this camera can do in capturing most, if not all, photos that a non-professional photographer would take.  If you want more, pay more.Lastly, I still want to have a smaller point & shoot camera that will fit into my pocket for reasons of portability and convenience.  This Nikon camera does not do that - It's too bulky for a pants pocket and I am sure too much mass for purses.But, for basic business, home, and general use, and ...to enjoy a great camera without too many confusing, time-consuming, or 'makes-no-difference' fine-tuning options, and ...to satisfy that NCIS desire to have a professional-looking Nikon (without paying the price), even if only for a fleeting peek and approval by casual onlookers,then this camera is a no-regrets buy.

Reviews.Title: An amazing camera for the price
Reviews.Author: matt
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing, I instantly fell in love with it. The Nikon L820 is, in my opinion, the best camera for the money. With 16MP and a 30x optical zoom lense it is unmatched. I have been educating myself on cameras and photography for years and now knowing what I do, I can tell you that any person novice or pro will like this camera. It has great features and shooting modes which come in handy for helping you to get the best picture you can, but if you want you can manually do everything! The pictures are extremely crisp and vivid. The movies are breath taking. Perfect for out door shooting on the account the zoom lense can get you close to wildlife. Also the panorama setting helps with taking amazing landscapes. Nikon has come out with a slightly updated version of this camera (L830) that is the same, except the zoom, which is 34x. So if you really want the extra zoom spend the extra $60.
