Reviews.Title: Good Camera with few limitations
Reviews.Author: Arin "MN Electronics Geek"
Reviews.Content: Please read some extensive reviews already available about this camera.  I have been a Nikon user for many years specifically the D-series and had expectations about some basic features that I am used to.  The Menu is rudimentary with no customizations available and you cannot turn on the camera (or connect it with USB) without removing the lens cap.  You cannot even play your files without removing the lens.  Not sure which genius at Nikon thought about this as not being an inconvenience to the user!  Lastly the pictures are all in JPEG and I am used to taking pictures in RAW for editing using Nikon's customer software, but that is a moot point.  Beyond the gripes here, the camera is good for quick pictures and videos, especially on trips where I do not bring along the D-series with the various lenses.  Overall, not a bad buy, but I would not recommend it for now.

Reviews.Title: Very Easy to Use - Battery?
Reviews.Author: Emily Hathcock
Reviews.Content: I have not had a chance to use this camera very much - but so far so good! It is very user friendly for someone who isn't a professional photographer (like myself) but likes good quality pictures of the kiddos! It is very easy to just "snap and shoot." Directions are easy and clear. It also comes with a case and neck strap which is very nice.I was surprised to see that it actually used batteries instead of a rechargeable one like my old digital cameras (I used to own the "normal" looking unfancy cameras, but they broke very easily!). However, I read somewhere that this is b/c it was originally designed for travelers - and that many times they do not have time to recharge a battery or would not have an extra rechargeable battery handy. In some cases European hotels would not have a compatible outlet or extra outlets to recharge a battery. Therefore, it would be easy to stop just about anywhere and pick up batteries to use in the camera. That is all fine and dandy, but I am just a normal mom who doesn't travel much but I do plan on investing in a battery re-charger to cut down on battery cost. I also don't use my camera a lot daily so I don't think it will be a major problem. If you can deal with this then I would recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the $$
Reviews.Author: Marta Michilizzi
Reviews.Content: Only thing I would like to see different is a rechargeable battery... this is powered by AA batteries.  It seems like too nice of a camera to not have it's own rechargeable battery.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Book Worm
Reviews.Content: This is a nice upgrade for me from my previous pocket style Nikon camera that despite a new battery never came back to its original quality.  I did some reading and research on cameras based on what I wanted before I ultimately ended up purchasing this camera.  I wanted a camera that was easy to use with good results, affordability was a definite factor and since I occasionally sell items on the net, I wanted more color clarity with reds, blues and purples looking more like their true colors than what I was getting with my old camera.  With this camera, I can get true likeness of these difficult colors  with less tweaking and manipulation.  This camera has so many features, I am still learning and probably will not even use everything it has to offer. At this time, there is a lot of info you can read about this camera if you do a search and so far it lives up to my expectations.  It's easy to use with automatic settings.  It has a great flash and for more advanced photographers you have manual control as well. Having my family photos look so good with so much clarity makes me feel like a pro!  No grainy look here!  The vivid color and ease of use for the price of this camera is very satisfying.  I tried the video and no complaints with clear sound and video.  If you purchase this camera, make sure you get a good memory card and I would recommend using AA rechargeable batteries.  Overall, for price and quality, I couldn't be happier with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Very fast recovery - great pics
Reviews.Author: Scott C. Boito "scoob5555"
Reviews.Content: Our last few cameras have been Fujifilms and I had gotten used to the slow recovery time. Much better than our previous cameras.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L820 16 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 30x Zoom Lens and Full HD
Reviews.Author: Roberto
Reviews.Content: The perfect 1st camera for me.  Full HD, 16MP, with 30x Zoom Lens with that price is just perfect. I was originally going to buy the Sony RX100 or a Canon T3i but I did not want to drop that amount of money on a camera and then have to buy all the lenses for it. There are a lot of cameras out there better than the Coolpix L820 but, it all comes down to what you are using it for.  I use it to shoot youtube videos and take amateur photos of electronic components (small resistors and PCBs).

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L820
Reviews.Author: James Bonneville
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in addition to my pocket camera for those times I want a greater choice of features. This camera takes incredible pictures whether in macro or telephoto. I find that when taking macro it is best to use a tripod and use the the self-timer to avoid any posssibility of camera shake when pressing the shutter release. After studying numerous cameras I chose this one for it's many features and very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Camera is Perfect
Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: So I cannot say I did a ton of research on digital cameras but I knew I wante something that could take decent pictures, do short videos and was easy to use.  This camera fits the bill but I will readily admit that I probably do not use half the features.  The flash works well, zooms easily and overall is simple to operate. I bought this camera to document our home renovations and it has served that purpose well.  My favorite feature....I love the color.  I would definitely recommend this camera to others.  Everyone from my less than tech savvy mother to my young son has been able to use this camera without any problem and I would buy it again.Two drawbacks:I know this is minor but figuring out the battery configuration was not easy until I realized the directions were listed inside the little wells.  Everyone who has had to put batteries in has done it wrong the first two or three times.  Second - it may very well be possible to review pitures with the lens cap on and I just haven't bothered to read the instructions yet.....but it isn't intuitive.  I would like to be able to review photos without having to remove the lens cap.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: KSTAR
Reviews.Content: Best Camera ever and so worth the price. I originally wanted the DSLR but for the price this camera packs a pretty good punch and it has lots of cool features like panoramic and selective color etc.  The photo quality is amazing also

Reviews.Title: I AM LOVING IT
Reviews.Author: Princess Claudette
Reviews.Content: This camera is the bestest....its awesome.So many wonderful features...having fun playing photographer.My daughter is enjoying it as well

Reviews.Title: Loved my new camera
Reviews.Author: Gray Samuels "Skafro68"
Reviews.Content: Just came back from two weeks in England and my Coolpix took excellent shots throughout. Terrific wide angle and zoom. Best part about it is you can take most indoor pictures without a flash. It makes the necessary adjustments. It's not as convenient as a phone camera, but it takes much better photos.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the money
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I am an armature photographer and I don't have a lot of cash on hand to buy a SLR type of camera, but I love this thing! Great image resolution, cool settings (color selective mode, 3D imaging, Awesome low light capabilities, ect.). I like the AA battery aspect of this camera, battery dies, pop a new one.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Elle Woods
Reviews.Content: This is a really good camera for the price.  The zoom is great, it has a lot of different user friendly settings, and takes very nice pictures.  It's a little bulky, but worth it for the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: first nikon.
Reviews.Author: terry tetzlaff
Reviews.Content: this is my first Nikon, I have had Olympus cameras before. This camera is very well built, and the few pictures I have taken thus far have turned out great. I love the camera because it uses AA batteries, which I can get anywhere. I however purchased rechargeable batteries easier to deal with. Love it so far.

Reviews.Title: Takes Great Pictures for a Low Price
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Brown "Lizzy"
Reviews.Content: We just received this camera and have used it for our kids fall photos and for a family picture. The quality of pictures blows my other camera away. You can edit pictures and add effects before even downloading the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: BT Agility "BT fan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for an upcoming trip but have used it a lot already.  Love the ease of the video, pictures are fine.  Light enough to go into a purse.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: KCam "Kristy Cameron"
Reviews.Content: Great camera!!!!  Easy to use with fabulous pictures.  I'm using some of the photos that I took on vacation in my next children's book.

Reviews.Title: new feature found everyday
Reviews.Author: Wayne Williams
Reviews.Content: saying i like it now but i find a new feature on it everyday so will most likely turn in to i love it

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera I've ever used
Reviews.Author: Henry K. Hermann
Reviews.Content: Nikon scored a home run with this one.  Two days after I got it, I took a three week trip to Europe shooting under all sorts of conditions and 1200 exposures later I was convinced that this was Nikon's best product ever.  I've owned half a dozen of their SLR's over the years and always admired their reliability and durability as well as the quality of images they produced but combining the CMOS sensor with an excellent glass zoom lens that gives me wide angle to extreme tele shots is a super idea.  I know that for 200 dollars you've got to cut corners but it would have been nice if they could have included a users manual too.  I didn't want to carry a tablet and besides I was in a lot of places that didn't have wifi so I had to learn by experimentation.  Fortunately the camera is very user friendly once you understand the way the menus are organized.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jill Derksen
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing photos. it's lightweight and easy to use. has a lot of fun filters and modes too if you like that kind of thing. my only drawback is that it takes batteries. so get yourself a battery charger and some rechargeables. For me, that made it a little old school. making it USB rechargeable would have made it far better. but other than that, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: REALLY WORTH YOUR MONEY
Reviews.Author: yehuda knopf
Reviews.Content: 1st things 1st. while i was considering to which camera to buy i was trying to find out what is being given to you besides the actual camera. i havent found any post about it so just gonna mention whats in the package-camera-2 cds: a reference manual cd and a software cd to upload on your computer. both are very well designed and easy to use..anyone with nikon really has alot to get out of besides the camera..dont have the time to go thru every detail on the cds, ill be here for another year typing..-usb cord about foot long or so- these 3 plugin cables to attach to tv or whatever theyre used for..i dont really use it so i dont really know what it can be used for..-you also get the actual module guide in a booklet as oppose to the cd..whatever works..im sure theres some sort of diff bet the2 just dont have the time to find one....-nikon neck strap-a cover for the lensthe camera is excellent. i saw in the comments that ppl complained that if you zoom in the camera shakes and you lose stability and cant take a proper picture. i can tell you thats not fully true i realized the camera shakes bec its probably too sensitive-its your hands that cant keep it perfectly straight when your zoomed and focused at a particular thing- i zoomed it on my table its totally fine..if you have trouble keeping it straight the solution is put on the flash button- i realized that even if you can keep your hands steady enough to take a clear pic- as long as the flash is on itll come out perfectly fine...the zoom is absolutely amazing.. i took a pic about 15 feet or more away from a yogurt can and i was able to read the ingredients on it!! it has a very sharp zoom for pics and video really fantastic to see!!!the thing that makes this camera diff then others is the sd card slot..for some reason idk why when you insert the sd card it still will run on the camera memory and i still havent figured how you can swap it..what will happen is itll go on camera mode and if or when you run out of space it will move to the sd card..you can also take a pic  and copy it to the sd card memory afterwards- just its a little annoying if your concerned the camera will just suddenly break and you'll lose those very few(its only about 45 mega bites on the camera- about 10 pics..) pics on the camera. im not so fussy about it...just buy a good case and and take pics only when the strap is in your hand or around your neck and you'll be fine..ive been taken pictures for a number of years and ive had no problems doing that..i would give a 4.5 star bec of this small issue with the sd card but being there is no such thing as giving half a star ill give a 5..i feel bad for the bad ratings on this camera for those who dont know how to use one and are complaining about zoom when its not true.. if your looking for problems youll def find no matter how good the item is even if it were $1500. but if your like me that you just want a good camera and you'll deal with things that come on the way (if you want to call it a problem) you'll be totally grateful for buying this product..GUARANTEEDwish you all the greatest success!

Reviews.Title: I love my new camera
Reviews.Author: Anthony J. Reid Fennell
Reviews.Content: I definately love this camera ... It's color definately stands out and the quality of picture is amazing .I like the adjustments you can make on it . Works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: so nice camera
Reviews.Author: maria
Reviews.Content: its amazing semipro camera and 30X zoom amazing yes its not very cool but its niceand i like camera with AA battery cuz i dont need to recharge the battery every time and i can get batteries from any storeits easy and nice softwarei like Nikon

Reviews.Title: amazingly user friendly
Reviews.Author: ranjan mathews
Reviews.Content: although it had an initial set back on delivery,the camera is realy good in every way,i was amazed how user friendly it is and simple the operations are,its ideal for any situation and a plus plus to any family and home to capture your loved moments,i am also making pictures out side with nature and natural events and its  perpect to me ..i think made the correct choice..thank you

Reviews.Title: It takes photos, but so does my Minolta X-700
Reviews.Author: groundhog
Reviews.Content: The price dropped so I bought it for my wife.  She likes it.  It seems to be of good quality, and for the money it is a good camera.  I still use my Minolta X-700.  It takes photos as well.  I don't get too excited about much of anything.  No sense wasting energy at my age.  Buy it, you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: Take nice pictures
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: This camera does take very nice pictures. You have to play with the settings to see what setting takes the best for the type of picture you are taking. The book that comes with it does not explain all the different settings. I have had some problems trying to get really close ( micro ) pictures, it not wanting to focus in but when you get the right distance away you can get the shot. The strap that comes with it is to short around your neck, I took it back off. And 1 more thing where you hold it my thumb keeps hitting the bottons by accident. it is a little bit bigger then I wanted, I like to put my camera in my pocket and this one will not fit. Over all it is a nice camera. I had no problems in the shipping, it came right away.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! Love Nikon cameras!
Reviews.Author: Camerawoman
Reviews.Content: This is a great all around camera! It takes clear, sharp pictures with good color clarity. It's light weight but solid in the hands. I haven't tried the video yet but the pictures turned out great! It focused quickly too. The camera is easy to use and will be easier to carry on my trips than my larger heavier Nikon D7000 SLR. I love Nikon cameras. This is my 4th so far as I have upgraded through the years!  I don't think anyone will go wrong with this camera, beginner or professional. The lens cover can be attached to the strap so no losing it. Some stated this as a problem but perhaps Nikon saw this and added the attachment for the lens cap. All in all a great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Still Learning
Reviews.Author: JCW
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty easy to use. But I'm still learning. A little hard to hold still enough at high zoom (but that is to be expected). So far, so good. I'm a novice, so don't expect me to comment on any highly technical details.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L820
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Hartman
Reviews.Content: Lots of options on this camera that I am just learning.Will serve me well.Easy to hold onto and small enough to carry anywhere.

Reviews.Title: My Red Camera!
Reviews.Author: ronald peszynski
Reviews.Content: Love the color. Love that it is small and easy to grip!  Nothing bulky! Fits right in your hand! Great!

Reviews.Title: Did great for concert photos
Reviews.Author: David Cassidy fan in Texas
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take pictures at concerts. I was on the fence as reviews were mixed, but it did not disappoint. To be fair, I have only used it at one concert so far...more to come. I did read the instructions on the cd enclosed in the box and played with the different settings for a week or so. I discovered that the best setting for low light action shots (concerts) was the "AUTO" setting with a high ISO setting. This setting seemed to take better pictures that the sports setting under those circumstances.I am not a very experienced photographer, but I have learned to avoid taking the pictures using the "telephoto" or "zoom" option as those  were the only concert photos that came out blurry....it's impossible to hold the camera perfectly still (I do not have a tripod, and most concert venues will not allow them). The best way to achieve a closeup was to take the picture without zoom and edit it later on the computer.Overall for the price, I am very happy with the camera. I agree with some reviewers that a viewfinder would be nice for very sunny days, and you do have to remember to remove the lens cap before turning the camera on, but these are only minor hassles to me.

Reviews.Title: Best Digital Camera we have EVER had!
Reviews.Author: K. Brakenhoff
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use.  Excellent picture quality.  Gets a clear shot even when the kids can't be statues ;)  Also great for taking pet photos - no more crazy eyes!

Reviews.Title: i like nikon 820.very simple in use
Reviews.Author: alex m.
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for its price quality pictures in all light conditions,  easy to use good camera overall does everything that was specified

Reviews.Title: Re-mark-a-ble
Reviews.Author: garo
Reviews.Content: Just does a fabulous job!  Nice colors, crisp images and great zoom-zoom. Price was most reasonable and as usual Amazon's service was excellent...

Reviews.Title: Great for taking lots of photos!
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Walker
Reviews.Content: I love that this camera lets me take as many pictures as I want without stopping to process!  With my other camera it would take forever to take pictures because I would have to wait for it to sometimes process between every picture.  With this camera I haven't had to wait yet, love it!  I can take some really closeup pictures of birds in our backyard too.  I haven't experimented with it much yet but would recommend it to anyone in general.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Amy Dentremont "sarahsmom"
Reviews.Content: Very light, compact camera!  Tons of options!  Pretty red color!  Fantastic zoom! Would recommend this camera to anyone wanting a fun, lightweight, great photo taking camera.  Videos are fantastic as well!

Reviews.Title: My lovely wife absolutely loves it
Reviews.Author: geobar
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my lovely wife, she is very pleased with it.  Easy instructions and setup.  It continues to bring her joy every time she uses it.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, not the best design
Reviews.Author: MrCookie
Reviews.Content: This makes great images for a point and shoot camera, with great colors and details. Also, the time between two images is very short and the menu is very prompt. The only thing I don't like is the design - while it is relatively functional, it is not the most aesthetically pleasing. For the money I'd expect a little better (and the images here are not showing it from all angles). Also I don't like the fact that I need to deal with charging batteries again (I liked the built-in one on my old camera). Anyway, this all is not enough to take off a star--this camera DOES take amazing pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price...
Reviews.Author: Kelly Mooney
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend it if you are a point and shoot person looking to learn on your way to a SLR/DSLR. The pictures are amazing with not much effort. I had shopped around for a while, and Amazon was by far the best price. Waited a week for shipping, but it was free so no complaints. Go ahead...buy it!

Reviews.Title: Am very happy with the Camera.  I took it to work with me and took some pics of a construction.  GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: Pat Carney
Reviews.Content: I am doing a construction project at the Marine Base in 29 Palms and this is helping keep a visual record of the progress.  The Pics come out really great even in low light and the color is great.  Very simple to operate andI am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Shots from our trip to China
Reviews.Author: William R Shelton Sr
Reviews.Content: The zoom is terrific.  Really came into use , on our recent trip to China.  Some of the shots came out great.  Traveling on some of the buses, shooting from a moving vehicle, shots came out clear and crisp.  Simple to use.  Did have some issues with the panorama shots but think it was the settings I had on the camera.  So simple to use.

Reviews.Title: Better then I thought

Reviews.Content: It does everything that i need it to do and more. It may be small but it can do a lot. Everything came with it that was described to be with the camera. I would recommend this person or store to anyone.

Reviews.Title: love it!!!

Reviews.Content: This Is my first big purchase with amazon and everything w/ this camera has worked smoothly and I have taken tons of pictures already.... I love the up close features overall a nice camera.... I bought it a while back and im pretty sure I got a smoking deal on this NIKON because it was used.... more or less LNIB

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: gary r dagel
Reviews.Content: very nice camera sharp clear photos and nice zoom I really like it. recommend ordering extra memory and a case for it.

Reviews.Title: simple to use and good photos/videos
Reviews.Author: Ppkamik "Hilo"
Reviews.Content: The camera works great for pictures and videos. The zoom is amazing and is my perfect upgrade for a point and shot camera.I give it 4 stars just because the LCD display quality seem to be not that good and it gets easily scratched.. still I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Kristy Beals
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month now.  This camera is perfect if you are looking for a good quality camera, but don't want to pay the price of a DSLR.  Other people have said that in easy auto mode the camera blurs the picture, the reason for this is mostly likely they weren't steady when they took the pictures.  Also, if your target is moving it may blur a bit, but it doesn't happen as often if the camera is steady.  I almost always forget to use the motion feature when taking pictures of moving objects.  It takes a bit of getting used to, but I recommend getting a beginning photography book that shows the correct positions to take pictures, and it will most likely also show you how to adjust your cameras features in regards to what lighting you are working with, and also what kind of picture you are trying to take.  This camera does have the ability to change the ISO similar to the DSLR.  It also has a manual raised flash, which is definitely a nice feature..  I didn't see it shown anywhere in the pictures when researching this camera.  This camera also has the ability to take 3D pictures though I haven't used this feature yet.  I also have not used the video yet.  So far this camera hasn't disappointed, so I'm sure it will good as well.  It is true what people say about the lens cover in the respect that if it's on and you forget and turn the camera on it's probably not good.  I've done it a few times.  It's not a reason I wouldn't recommend this camera. Its just something to be aware of.  Overall, the quality of the pictures is excellent for this type of camera and when using the zoom it also takes good quality pictures.  I've had many compliments from other people after sharing my pictures on how great they are with this camera.

Reviews.Title: love, love, love this camera
Reviews.Author: Shirley A. Blackwell
Reviews.Content: It is amazing. I am no photographer but it makes me look like one. I have taken so amazing pics. So worth the cost. I highly recommend this camera for those that want great photos.

Reviews.Content: I have bought this recently and I must say that it is very good. The pictures are very nice and the features are professional enough to my level. I am well satisfied with this Nikon camera.

Reviews.Title: recomend

Reviews.Content: i just came from a trip  that i need a camera ligth, fast, and easy to use it and i hit the lottery with  my nikon coolpix l820

Reviews.Author: Ronald H. Radden "Ron R"
Reviews.Content: While my wife purchased the camera for her business, I have found to be very useful when I don't want to carry my DSLR. This means I have found it very handy for short trips to local attractions, where my primary interest is grab shots. The long range lens is very handy. Picture quality if fine for prints up to about 11x14.

Reviews.Title: It's a really great point & shoot alturnative to my larger cameras...
Reviews.Author: Sue Sorlucco
Reviews.Content: Very good for grabbing candids inside and out.  Clarity is exceptional..color is very good.  fits right under my car seat as well as in my right hand.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Jeri Tiller
Reviews.Content: Have 2 grandchildren and love capturing every moment I can. This is the perfect tool for doing just that. Awesome

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix L820
Reviews.Author: R. E. Stefancci
Reviews.Content: I have only taken about 50 pics and 2 videos with it so far with Very good results. It has more features than I will use in my lifetime. I am 71 and an occasional experienced amateur photographer. I do not like to carry a lot of equipment with me  when taking photos' and this camera can be set to shoot scenes in many varying light situations and distance from camera. The only equipment I carry besides the camera is a tripod and a monopod and a supply of AA Lithium batteries. After playing with the camera for about an hour when I received it and taking about 50 pics or so and two 2 or 3 minute videos the battery charge indicator still registers a full charge. I would recommend this camera to people who think like me and do not want to be bogged down with a ton  of equipment to take good pics and videos(1080P at that). One more thing, this camera takes standard AA batteries I put lithiums' in from scratch I didn't bother with the alkaline batteries supplied with camera.

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: Maria Angelica Beltran
Reviews.Content: It's perfect for beginners, it takes good pictures, has the perfect size and it has good quality for that price.

Reviews.Title: An excellent Camera at an affordable price

Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Has an excellent lens with a great range. shoots crisp pictures. It is a great digital camera for everyday use at a good price..

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Kennig73
Reviews.Content: This camera is what I expected and then some.  I was able to zoom in on my son on the football field and the result was clear concise pictures.  The camera is very easy to work, happy I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: This camera does it all
Reviews.Author: L. Tetreault
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews and talking with other owners, I settled on this camera and I am glad I did. It's easy to use (especially for this non-techy person) and delivers great shots. I'm still getting accustomed to finding the right screens to change settings, but I am very happy with this camera and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money.
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Eilert
Reviews.Content: I bought for African safari and it worked great.  The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures.  The zoom is awesome.  I took several thousand pictures, some long range and some right out the window of a moving car.  99% came out better than I expected.  I had a little trouble with the computer locking up; had to remove the batteries a couple times to restart the camera, but it came back each time.  It might have been operator error.  Also, the fire button started acting up toward the end.  I think it might just be dust inside.  The camera endured a lot of jarring around and dusty conditions of the 7 day safari.  My camera came with a convenient carrying case and everything I needed except for the memory card.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after not doing very much research but I didn't have to. This one was what I wanted in my price range. After using it at an indorse sports event I was impressed with the zoom and over all quality of the camera. It was smaller then I thought but still was easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Kandi S. Karell
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful!  Took a little while to learn all the features.  Not only will it zoom 30X to take a picture, after you have the picture, you can zoom again on screen.  This purchase is one of my better decisions!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, hope it last!

Reviews.Content: So far, I really like this camera. It takes good pics indoors without a flash. & Really good closeups such as flowers & insects. I haven't had time to use the full zoom yet. But I would recomend the camera to others. I've only had for a couple of months & it seems to be what I've been looking for.The only thing I worry about is the last Nikon I had broke on me just after a year.ThanksTina S.

Reviews.Title: Awesome

Reviews.Content: This is my first Nikon Camera, the zoom is awesome, takes full HD videos and the resolution is just great, very light and the box contains almost everything you'll need.

Reviews.Title: east to use
Reviews.Author: gordon mcguire
Reviews.Content: loaded with features that are easy to get to know while offering quality shots on all levels. hard to beat at such a price.

Reviews.Title: Best photos for camera without exchangeable lens

Reviews.Content: I have about seven cameras and this takes best pictures and easiest to use.  I had my husband's canon high end but I struggled with it. Plus I did not think pictures he took with it were any better or as good with this mighty Nikon

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera ...

Reviews.Title: Perfect

Reviews.Title: Amazing semi-pro camara

Reviews.Content: It's a great digital camera, amazing design, powerful lens, and user-friendly menus and functions. Reviews.Title: Fantastic buy for the money!
Reviews.Author: M. auten "49er"
Reviews.Content: Love my new Coolpix camera. Great telephoto with crisp  pictures . Have used  it at football games with great results.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Edith Rose
Reviews.Content: Simple camera with good resolution. Small enough to tuck in purse. Like using AA batteries and seem to last a long time.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Samwise Gamgee "Sam"
Reviews.Content: Love the zoom, and the features.  Takes great pictures.  Wish it was smaller so it was easier to carry and had a lithium rechargeable battery.  Bought rechargeable AAs to use with it.  Would be nice if it came with the SD card but I had an old one lying around so that worked out fine too.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: GENE
Reviews.Content: 30 optical zoom is great. Very easy to use.  Recommend it to any one who wants a great camera with easy to use features.

Reviews.Title: The camera just I needed
Reviews.Author: Leon
Reviews.Content: I love this camera since the very moment I opened the box. It has everything that I want and much more. Simple, easy to use, and the quality of the pictures & video are great. The zoom is just amazing and it comes with a very user friendly software too. If you are looking for the kind of options and features offered by an SLR camera, don't buy this; but if you just want to keep it simple and enjoy taking good pictures, you can't go wrong with this one.I already got the original AC power cable and it also works great when I take videos.However, in using video mode, the screen keeps showing a 30 minutes of maximum recording time, even when  a lower resolution quality is selected, (the camera should be able to take longer shots, as you choose a lower video resolution/quality). They told me that I was using an SD card non recommended by the manufacturer. Obviously, I hadn't have access the Reference Manual at the time of the purchase, so I bought the SD card suggested by Amazon (which is not on the list, of course). I already ordered a new SD card, so let's see what happen...  Apart from that, I think I will enjoy this camera for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Amazing HD Video

Reviews.Content: I really love this camera. I bought it for the video capabilities and fell in love with it immediately. The HD makes the videos come out amazingly clear. The fact that it takes great photos is a huge bonus.

Reviews.Author: Eamacire
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. The picture quality is great even zoomed all the way on something. The sound quality on videos is also really good, not distorted or muffled.

Reviews.Title: Camera is easy to use and resolution is marvelous.
Reviews.Author: Norma J. Greenfield
Reviews.Content: Easy to focus.  Resolution is fantastic when the pictures transferred to a computer and minute details can be visualized.  It is a little hard to get things in the view finder at very high zoom levels when the sun makes it hard to see the screen, but I think that would be true of any camera that does not have a direct view through a lens.

Reviews.Title: great color
Reviews.Author: Susan Hutchinson
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  The shutter speed is good but the color resolution is better than any other compact camera zI have ever had.  Can't go wrong with Nikon

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Dallas Riddle
Reviews.Content: Excellent item. Easy to use. Photo quality is better than I ever expected. I love all the "extra" features. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: Husband really likes it.
Reviews.Author: Lynda
Reviews.Content: Camera was for my husband. He really likes it. Takes great pics and you can edit right there. He has gotten some great shots of the wildlife here in the mtns!

Reviews.Title: best digital camera ever owned
Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife's birthday, It is easy to use, and takes great pictures. zoom/telephoto work very well. So far we can't find any cons about this great little camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: A. federal Union "Teddio"
Reviews.Content: great camera with 30x zoom...who needs DSLR? Much better than other cameras that I have tried.BUY IT....best camera at great price, and FREE shipping....what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Bowles Jr.
Reviews.Content: The camera fits my hand like a glove.It is very easy to operate and has several features that I will eventually try out.I would recommend this camera for anyone that needs a basic camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and is easy to use.  Received plenty of compliments from people who have tested it out.  Great investment.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera
Reviews.Author: Ann M. Berka "retired08"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera it does everything I expected it to do.  Took it on a trip to Washington DC and pictures came out great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Angry Customer
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera for the price!Great zoom capacity!Video feature---easy to use record button.If you forget your card, this camera has storage capacity built in!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Drizzella MO "drizzella"
Reviews.Content: I bought this, camera for a trip to Alaska especially to photograph animals at a distance. I am very impressed with the quality. The 30x zoom gave me a sharp picture and the stabilizer keep everything in focus even at the longest length. Easy to use with self explanatory controls, especially if you've owned a digital point and shoot. I had a Canon Powershot which was over six years old and has a shorter zoom lens. It still worked great but was heavier and the stabilizer wasn't as good. Highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Souder
Reviews.Content: Light weigh, great pictures, easy to use, zoom operates well, only negative; I prefer regardable batteries, but the price was right!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Lisel Campbell
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for the price.  40 x zoom works well, photo quality is great.  Buy one!!!!  solid when holding it in your hands.

Reviews.Title: Love using this camera.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Had a virtually the same Fuji. The lens needed to be replaced and it was still under warranty, but they refused saying I had dropped it. I did not. So I got the Nikon. Had an earlier model which my husband uses now. Really enjoyed using it and got great pics on our last trip. I love the red color because I know it is mine and not one of all the black ones.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: angela bye
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and very easy to use. I recently took this camera on vacation to Washington, DC and it was a joy to operate. This camera is very kid friendly. My 11 year old son was able to use this camera with ease.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Nneka
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing in color, quality, and size. It has perfect pictures and even lights up some dim backgrounds/pictures even without flash. I love this, I got it for my birthday and  can't stop using it. It comes with everything and it's just an amazing product overall, I would definitely recommend this camera to anybody especially to those who aren't professional photographers but love taking pictures. :)

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Click Camera
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Wallace
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great camera for right under $200.  I knew I couldn't pay the $400+ that the SLR cameras cost, so after doing a lot of research on basic cameras, this seemed like it had a lot to offer and had good ratings by most.  I'm just a basic camera user, looking for a camera to take kid and family pictures.  It has a nice heft to it, and takes great basic pictures.  It doesn't have a viewfinder, but most other cameras in this price point don't as well.  You do have to remember to take the lens cap off before powering up the camera.  Takes very nice automatic pictures and the other picture settings were very easy to navigate and use.  The time between pictures is fairly quick and better than my old camera.  The only reason I am giving this four stars, is I haven't yet figured out how to take continuous shots of my kids.  I have the hardest time getting a good picture of my four year old, and to get all three of my kids to actually look at the camera at the same time is next to impossible.  I was hoping a continuous shot feature (don't even know if that's what you call it) would help me, but I haven't found this feature with some basic playing around.  I haven't read the manual yet, so I might be able to make this happen (I'm hoping).  I just haven't figured it out yet.  Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: benbm
Reviews.Content: easy to use...takes great pictures...love the zoom capability.  I have recommended it to several friends.  Also like the red color!

Reviews.Title: Love my new Camera!!
Reviews.Author: cataloca17@hotmail.com
Reviews.Content: Really nice Camera... the only thing I don't like is the fact that uses AA batteries. Other than that it is a great product. Pictures are really neet...love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Does exactly what I want it to,
Reviews.Author: Mike Toolan
Reviews.Content: and more.5 stars for an accurate description of the product. It takes gorgeous pictures, clean video, and the wide angle lens is perfect.Not very compatible with my Chromebook, but that's not the camera's fault. Doesn't overcomplicate anything and is very easy to use. Fun to experiment with.

Reviews.Title: The Nikon L820 is better than my expectation
Reviews.Author: Norm Eisenberg
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that could self focus as well as offer a large zoom for framing pictures.  I also needed to produce very good pictures.  It does all that and much more.  The battery life is better than expected.  I bought the rechargeable batteries with charger to along with it.  All of it is performing very well and has exceeded my requirements. I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Reallly great crisp pictures
Reviews.Author: Sue Bloom
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I am traveling overseas and wanted a more compact camera than my Canon Rebel. This camera has the advantage of being compact but does not compromise on quality. I like the fact that you can set up the photos without having to photo shop to get special effects. I am really looking forward to using it on my vacation later this year. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Just arrived
Reviews.Author: SexyDiva
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever bought for this price. I have just been playing around and I already love it, nice quality, clear photos, and very nice video. I haven't even messed with all the features yet. I am excite to play with my new camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera impressive pictures and video
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Pictures look great HD video is great. Camera settings and modes all work great. The 3D setting is confusing. Not sure what it does but oh well. Great camera easy to use and can't go wrong with that color.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Derek G Williamson
Reviews.Content: Great value, 30x zoom works great, I love that I can use regular AA batteries.I wish it came with a SDHC card.

Reviews.Title: What am I missing?
Reviews.Author: C. Herrmann
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera this past week based off of glowing reviews and a neighbor who owns it and has taken great pictures. I have been impressed by the quality of the pictures that have been taken outside, the HD video seems very good too. However, all the action shots I've taken of my kids have been BLURRY! I'm not talking about a little blurry, but so blurry you can't see who they even are. Even when trying to take pictures of my 3 year old, the pictures are blurry unless she is 100% still (which when does that happen, right?). I have tried taking pictures on all the different settings and nothing seems to help. My old $100 Canon point and shoot would capture better pictures when kids were moving. I'm not asking for perfection, but shouldn't the camera be able to capture my son or daughter running without them looking like a smoky cloud is around them? I'm not trying to be too hard (yet) on the camera. I'd really like to know if I'm doing something wrong and maybe missing a setting. I'm not a complete novice when it comes to electronics, so I'm feeling frustrated that this is happening. I want to like the camera. I really like the price tag, but not unless I can get crisp pictures of my kids just being kids. I'm just a mom trying to capture my kids being young. Any input would be greatly appreciated!!!Also, it seems as though the camera runs "slow". It takes a while between taking each picture.Please help!

Reviews.Title: not as great as I thought
Reviews.Author: sandra martins
Reviews.Content: This camera battery sucks the life out of new batteries. Cannot believe after normal use the battery is drained. I rather just go back to using my 35 mm what it cost in processiong I pay in batteries. I would love to return it but passed my return time. My sis has a Cannon and there battery is not AA, so she does not have this problem. Very old school to have AA batteries for a digital even my 35mmm has a better battery. REGRETS!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: BIG bang for BUCK
Reviews.Author: Amazon Lover
Reviews.Content: Got this just 1 day before our trip to Lake Tahoe. I don't have powerful batteries at home. Just dumped some normal AA batteries we bought at a local walmart. I took 400 + pictures, still the battery symbol is showing full. I am wondering if this camera needs power or run on its own. The zoom is very powerful. If you know Lake Tahoe, my son took a video of Eagle falls from the cruise  , when we are at T-house. With normal eye, you can not even notice that there are falls. He don't even have a tripod. We love this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Nothing Special
Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: This camera is a high-priced point-and-shoot. Nothing special, and took worse photos than my iPhone camera. We promptly returned it.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: C. Thurman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera September 2013. I am a huge fan of Nikon. I also own a DSLR. While on a trip to Yosemite a couple of week ago, I received the dreadful "LENS ERROR" message. I was so incredibly disappointed that I couldn't use the 30x zoom which is the only reason I brought it with me on my trip. Prior to leaving on my trip to Yosemite, I considered bringing one camera. Thankfully, I trusted my gut and brought my DSLR with me. I'm hoping to be able to have it replaced through Nikon as I haven't even had a year yet.

Reviews.Title: Camera Came Defective
Reviews.Author: Keno from Detroit
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, liked all the options.  The camera arrived defective from the manufacturer.  The scroll up/down button did not work, preventing flash settings from working as well as other menu items.  I wish the manufacturer would of checked the camera before packaging it.  It seems like product checking from China is non existent.  Returning to Amazon for replacement.  Thank-you Amazon for a hassle free return!

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC CAMERA/VIDEO CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Cookson "Charley"
Reviews.Content: So far, I absolutely LOVE this camera!!  Have been looking for a camera/video camera for some time now and this one did NOT disappoint!  Easy to learn to use and control.  Love the BEAUTIFUL shots it takes!  Fits on a tripod easily or around your neck!  Shoots well in the dark too!  Video camera is great!  Good quality...1080p HD!!!  LOVE IT!!!!  Easy to Recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: very nice!
Reviews.Author: the crunch
Reviews.Content: while there are some settings that can't be manually set, over all this a very good automatic with lots of ways to adjust settings type of camera. if you want to see a lady happy, buy her a camera like this and see her face when she takes a picture of her children

Reviews.Title: Great feel, great photos, but definitely need to buy extra memory.
Reviews.Author: Sister of Moses "SM"
Reviews.Content: Great feel when holding this camera. Takes great photos and love the zoom capabilities. But you will definitely need to add to your cart extra memory. We took four pictures and one HD video before it was full so we had to go buy memory. But now we love it!

Reviews.Title: My first 'real' camera.. great images, great zoom.
Reviews.Author: Paul D Farber "PDF"
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the positive reviews.  This camera is great and I have had no issues after week of use.  The zoom is awesome and the photo's are clear and sharp.  I have only used about 10% of the features and none of them have let me down as far as picture quality is concerned.The LCD screen is very sharp and makes viewing photo's easy.  It would have been nice to get an HDMI cable instead of the RCA cable... but that's a $5 item.Great camera... would buy another one if this one broke.

Reviews.Title: good grab and go camera

Reviews.Content: It does everything I need but controlls are tiny, I like that it has AA batteries, and that it can connect directly to my computer.  Good price and light weight

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L820 16 MP CMOS cámara digital con objetivo zoom 30x y Full HD
Reviews.Author: BRACHO'S
Reviews.Content: excellent camera, take photos and record in HD. The images are very sharp and can use in day and night, I recommend it very elegant and works very well

Reviews.Title: Nice camera with issues
Reviews.Author: fiddler "imbuzz"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and with AA batteries there are always replacements close at hand, well usually.  The SD card is in the same compartment as the batteries and that compartment cover is a bit awkward to open and close so use the USB cabe to down load.  Focus at extreme telephoto can be an issue but try landscape setting in the menu for distant images or portrait if closer, eg ten feet.  Also to be kept in mind is that the zoom function zooms 30X of lens function then another 4X of image area, and resolution, reduction.  Auto Focus in the latter can be less effective.

Reviews.Title: woah!  WHAT a camera!
Reviews.Author: solocanoe
Reviews.Content: SO we have been dealing with 2 kids in all kinds of sporting events with a Canon EOS Rebel digital...we had an old 35mm Rebel (remember when Agassi had long hair and camera's took rolls of film?!!!)  and then we moved to the Digital and then we started buying the lenses.  AND more lenses.  AND more lenses.  It seems our camera bag would get bigger and heavier each year...we finally went to a backpack!oh yeah...since everyone loves video...we'd also carry a camcorder!  One shooting pics, one video.  ugh.  Anyway, the digital zoom in the camcorders was just kicking butt over the SLR with it's lenses you had to pack and then change out all the time....and now they are starting to get nutso over backpacks at sporting events...anyway, we searched the BEST and WELL RATED Digital Zoom camera on Amazon - that came with Prime and free returns if we didn't like it.  haha - you couldn't pay us for this camera now!The zoom is just beyond words...really...unless you pay $5000 for a lens for an SLR camera...you aren't getting closer than this little gem.  Auto focus is amazing, even at the most magnification!  It's just wonderfully simple to operate and our pics come out amazing from the camera shop printer.  We used to print our own...but hey, at around 50 cents for a hard copy when we want one...who needs a photo printer at home!Video's - yeah...we don't carry the camcorder anymore either!  just an extra memory card!  Takes fantastic, HD, full action video that just looks amazing on the ipad or even hooked up to the TV.It fits in my wife's purse easily...and we walk hands free now.  If I'm carrying it it fits in a jacket pocket or hangs on my neck just fine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: marten
Reviews.Content: Perfect product, i love Nikon i think it's the best in cameras around the world. Great quality of materials, excellent relationship cost-quality this model it's exactly what an amateur photographer like me needs.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Midwest Mom
Reviews.Content: Looked at cameras in the store to see what I liked with regards to the feel, weight, etc.  Then after searching around online.  I just got knowledge overload and went with this Nikon because I liked the feel of it in the store and it had a 30x zoom lens to take soccer photos.It performed very well on our trip to Colorado.  I tried using some of the stabilization features and that made it take too long to get a shot.  I also had trouble in lower light situations and the pictures came out blurred.  The sports setting for taking many shots was great for the "jump" photo of the wedding party.  The zoom worked great for catching a hummingbird in motion.  I had trouble loading the pictures into the software so I just used them from the computer folder.Great camera at a great price for taking photos that are better than with a smaller point and shoot without having settings and lenses to worry about.

Reviews.Title: Impressed!
Reviews.Author: JustMe "Just Me"
Reviews.Content: Ok..... Just got my camera today wooooohoooooo!The one thing that disappointed me so far (but is in a way my fault), it didn't come with a memory card and I thought it did. I have one ordered, but it didn't come today. It did come with 4 alkaline batteries that are NOT rechargeable, they say they are for trial use; but I also ordered 4 re-chargeable batteries with  a charger. Got them today as well; so as soon as I get my memory card I will be all set to snap away!  B004RP2VNI  (Recommended by a another reviewer)I ordered the red camera and it is G*O*R*G*E*O*U*S! I normally don't like red, but didn't want black; glad I chose this color, it is perfect, almost a candy apple red car color LOL!It's not much heavier than the smaller Kodak camera I had (with a lot less features!), and I like how it feels in my hands; also love how the flash can be raised and lowered, that makes it more like the old cameras we used to have before digital :) Don't have to scroll through stuff to turn it on or off.For the reviewer that said the lens cover hooks onto the lens....NO it does not! It attaches to the inside of the area surrounding the lens, but yes you do have to remove it before turning it on. This doesn't bother me in the least, I'm glad for the protection! But I'm not going to risk messing it up by trying it out to see if it actually does grind if it's on when I turn on the camera. Not to say some time I might forget to remove it, because yes that did happen with an older camera I had. But with it; the cap did attach to the lens, so when I turned it on, it automatically popped the cap off; so no biggie!The manual says to attach the lens cover to the neck strap, but if you don't want to use it, you can attach it to the camera itself; whichever you choose for yourself. I am also waiting for screen protector covers, I don't want to scratch my view screen. I accidentally took a pic trying to figure it out, but will update as soon as I try it out for real. B00D64K3KY****UPDATE:****I still haven't gotten my memory card yet, it might be in my mail box as I type this, but I just wanted to say I AM IN LOVE WITH THIS CAMERA! It is sleek, bright and shiny and I love how it handles!I have been taking a few pictures with the internal memory and they have all turned out A*W*E*S*O*M*E*! This is almost a "just point and shoot" camera. You gently hold the button down until it focuses (in a very few seconds) then push and it takes the picture before you know it, it's amazing! And it's very worth waiting those few seconds to focus.I took 3 pictures of the sky the other day and they turned out awesome, the great thing about it was.....I didn't have to use the zoom at all, and they looked like I could touch the clouds! With my old camera I had to zoom it all the way, then they looked blurry and not very crisp or clear. Also when you are focusing, you can move the camera back and forth until you get the perfect focus, with my old camera; I had to let go of the button, go back or forth, then hold the button again; and I lost the focus every time I had to do this. If I was trying to get a pic of say...my dog, she would have moved before I got it to focus and I lost the shot. Not with this baby, you'll get your picture before you realize you've pushed the button, I've actually suprised myself by "accidentally" pushing the button before I was completely ready, but the shot was still in focus and looked great LOL!As I said in the first review the manual says to attach the lens cord to the camera strap, I did that and every time I tried to use it, the lens flopped in my way banging the side of the camera; so I first attach the lens cord to the left side of the camera, then put the camera strap through the lens cord and all is well. The lens cap will dangle of course, but it is no longer in my way and doesn't bang on the camera.I make Cards For Soldiers (CFS) and they get sent to our soldiers overseas to send home to family and friends. I have taken pictures of some of the cards, and they look so great, I am just astounded at how this camera captures the images! With my old camera I had a terrible time trying to get a decent image of a card, no matter how I tried to focus, close up or at a distance, it just didn't do my cards justice. And especially with white, it would shine and you couldn't see the image because of the brightness of the card. I can lay my cards down; hold this camera right above it and just move it until I get it in focus and snap; the image is perfect. I wish I could post the pics for you to see. If anyone knows how I can, please let me know; I would love to be able to show what I'm talking about.** The only thing so far that I found that I really don't care for is the little "door" where you plug your usb cable into. I'm afraid if I use it very much it will break off, and that will make me very angry! I think Nikon should have had a better idea for that. It slides out, then lifts up, but it has 2 small hinges that are not very flexible, it barely opens far enough to plug in the cord. You have to be very gentle with it; or it definitely would break easily.Ok, that is all for this review, I will update again when I get my memory card and actually get to go picture taking of the scenery etc.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Fire Lady
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera before taking a trip from Nashville, TN to Montana, Wyoming, South Dakota, and North Dakota for 10 days. Took over 1200 pics. Camera was great. Wonderful zoom and quick focus made for a lot of great pictures of the trip. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: COOLPIX L820
Reviews.Author: Dusty Pulver
Reviews.Content: We chose this camera after reading the reviews and comparison-shopping on-line.  We found all the features touted were true; images reflect the finder and, in the full-auto mode, are clear, sharp, and faithful to color, regardless of variations in lighting.  Finder screen clarity and resolution is very high,  zoom optics deliver across the full range, shake-stop works well.  Movie mode is smooth and sound fidelity is excellent.  Stop- motion cycles quickly.  Liked the fact that the camera has memory for more pics in case card is forgotton or becomes full or inoperative.  Camera works well with standard AA batteries - a plus in a pinch, for sure.On the diappointing side, we found the finder screen is hard to see when backlit by strong sun, and pic composition becomes problematic as a  result.  Lens cap is great, but we keep forgetting to remove it before turning on the camera and fumble our quick-pic opportunities once in a while.  But we're loving it anyway!.

Reviews.Title: Clear picture
Reviews.Author: tlove
Reviews.Content: Saw this camera in Sam's club, took few pictures close and far and as people passed by, the pictures were so clear, this is what I had been looking for a sharp clear picture from far away.  Pulled up amazon to read the reviews and found it $65 dollars cheaper than Sam's, so I figured I could wait a few days and ordered it from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Very very poor autofocus
Reviews.Author: Nhery
Reviews.Content: Oh God this camera is just horrible. you will have to really hold your hand very steadily and firmly to take crisp pictures. almost all pictures are blurry very blurry i can never take a picture of my daughter moving or anythin moving. poor autofocus!!! Very disappointed with this camera, I returned mine. Save your money to get a micro four thirds camera like olympus pen pm1 the pictures are close to DSLR and it has very fast autofocus

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT. It has everything I want , very cool.
Reviews.Author: Shailesh Desai
Reviews.Content: Very good to own. It has everything what you want to have for photography  when you are traveling what else you want?

Reviews.Title: Returned it!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Shaw
Reviews.Content: A great quality picture but requires software download to transfer pictures to the computer. After troubleshooting for hours, I finally called Nikon customer service to find out that there's been a lot of problems with the software. They suggested I download from their website. I did this but after only 1 successful transfer, the software ceased to recognize new batches of pics. Unfortunately because the camera(&software;) was not user friendly and was not dependable, it had to go back!

Reviews.Title: Not great for kids... disappointed
Reviews.Author: Wedding Lady
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and many people seem to love this camera. Unfortunately, I do not. I got the camera 4 days ago because I wanted something that could capture my kids' funny moments... them playing, eating, sleeping, etc. without requiring too much setup or time. I had been using my iphone and Sony digital camera but the photos often looked blurry. Kids move quickly and I wanted a camera that could keep up. The Nikon Coolpix L820 has a fairly nice auto setting and approximately 12 presets (night, portrait, pets, sports, etc.)However, I found that none of the presets, including sports, could keep up with my kids. The photos always looked blurry. Manual mode seemed to work best but I always ended up with red eyes and blurred arms. I really wanted to love this camera but sadly, the pictures just aren't that great.There are some good things I should mention...1. The zoom IS very good2. This camera has a decent auto setting, which is nice if you're planning to shoot objects that don't move.Now, here's the bad things.1. Photos of moving people come out blurry no matter what setting I chose.2. All of my "kid" photos have red eyes and weird shadows.3. The lens cap situation that other people have mentioned IS DEFINITELY a nuisance.4. The colors taken inside my house always have a weird candlelit, yellow hue to them even though our house is white and bright. Yes, you can adjust the exposure but that's a pain each time.Overall, this camera may be great for taking distant photos of scenery but it NOT GREAT with moving people or inside shots.

Reviews.Title: Why I will never purchase from Nikon again
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Rudomen
Reviews.Content: This one-star review does not reflect the quality of the camera.  If you are reading this here, then please go ahead and purchase from Amazon.WHY I WILL NEVER PURCHASE ANYTHING FROM NIKON AGAINWhy?  The most bogus return policy I have ever heard of.  It must be returned within 14 days of receipt, and it has to be unopened....I bought this camera from Nikon as a Christmas present for my fiancee.  I thought I was being good, and shopped MORE THAN TWO WEEKS before Christmas.  She knows photography, and I don't.  I thought this camera would let her do what she wanted.  It turns out it has absolutely 0 manual settings, so you can't adjust the aperture or the frame rate or anything, you can just flip through a bunch of predetermined settings.  This is not what she wanted, but we opened it to see if there was ANY manual setting change that would let her accomplish what she wanted (there wasn't).So, we wanted to return it and pay the difference in exchange for a D3200 which DOES allow manual adjustment of, you know, settings a photographer would want control over?0 help.  "We have a very strict return policy."  Now I have a $250 camera that is a glorified smart-phone camera.  Lovely.How do you expect anyone purchasing something for Christmas any time before December, and to fall into this strict return policy?  It's ridiculous.  I asked to speak to a manager, and once more, verbatim, "We have a very strict return policy".The answer is simple, I won't be buying Nikon products again.If you are a photographer and know EXACTLY what you want, power to you and go ahead and shop from Nikon.  If you are purchasing for anyone else, and are not confident in exactly what a camera does and does not allow you to do, save yourself the trouble and DON'T BUY FROM NIKON.

Reviews.Title: My camera Stinks!
Reviews.Author: Legba Bogui
Reviews.Content: From the first minute with this camera I noticed it was terrible. I've got a Canon SX160 and 500 sitting right next to me, both of these cameras blow this one out of the water.Let me start by saying I think mine is defective. The zoom just will not focus, at all. If I want the zoom to focus I have to retract it all the way and zoom in again, and again, and again. If I'm lucky it will eventually focus on what I want - but only if I'm incredibly lucky.I thought it was something I was doing at first, but after testing some of my travel zooms at different zoom lengths, realized something is wrong with the Nikon. Even my compact elph will focus better than this thing.I played with a friends 810 a few weeks ago and really liked it, so, decided to get the 2013 model. What a giant disappointment.Within one day the camera malfunctioned twice. The first time the zoom just started sliding in and out non stop and the camera went berserk. I couldn't turn it off if I hit the power, but had to open the battery compartment while it was going crazy. Then, just this morning, I saw this really cool centipede/caterpillar/spider mutation thing. It was giant. I thought, "oh nice, I'll grab my 820 and take a really sweet close up from far away." Wrong. The damn zoom wouldn't focus at anything over 10x. I spent about 5 minutes standing around 10 meters away from my shot fiddling with the camera while the bug waited patiently. Then the camera goes berserk again. The "scene" function turned on and frantically started switching between all the modes. Again, I couldn't turn the camera off and had to open the battery compartment in order to stop the madness. Finally, I gave up, grabbed another zoom, and took a great photo. The camera has also "frozen" a few times while taking photos. It just locks up.There is one other thing I managed to notice in just two days. I'm not even going to go into the fact that something in the lens housing rattles if you move or slightly shake the camera, or the incredibly cheap plastic body (I don't mind a plastic body on a camera at all, it's the fact that this plastic body really seems like cheap plastic - dollar store toy plastic). The weird noises coming from this camera are stupefying me. I have six different cameras, two travel zooms, compacts, and a dslr - so I realize cameras make noises while working, but I've never in my life heard something like this. If you put the camera up to your ear there is this loud squealing noise. It's like running your nails down a clean window or maybe the chalkboard. It does not sound right at all - it definitely doesn't sound like something you would hear from a camera while it's processing.Bottom line: This model might be a defect. I will be exchanging it for another one, and if that one is in top notch working condition, I will retract my review and give stars where stars are due. Don't get me wrong, I really like the design of this camera. I've played around with a buddy's 810, loved how it felt and the shots it took, so thought the upgraded CMOS in the newer model will really knock me out. It did knock me out - in awe of how crappy it is. I don't even mind the housing it sits in, as long as the exchanged one works properly I will be keeping it. But what does this tell you about Nikon quality control? If I look where my other cameras are made - all Canon and Sony - all but one say "Japan." One is made in Malaysia. The Nikon 820 is made in Indonesia. I don't know much about quality control, or if it matters whether it's Japan or China or Mexico, but I know enough to say that there was very little control of any type on my model, let alone any quality.Update 05/01/2013:So the squealing noise was gone. And that was the only thing. The lens still rattled. OK, I can live with that. What I can't live with is the zoom. Just a simple test I did: The 820 in dimming light conditions, on a table, with an object about 20 meters away. Very, very slowly zooming in and getting the shot perfectly in frame, the zoom just right (high iso wide aperture etc etc). Then comes the focus... Oh yes the focus... Once, waiting - out of focus. Twice, waiting - out of focus. Thrice, waiting - out of focus. Itching to get the shot and all I see is a big blob. Let's try auto. Nope. Let's try 10m. I had to focus three times, but finally, we've got focus, time for a shot! Enough, no shot opportunity at 200mm this time, time for a video test: Video on, same lighting conditions, zooming in on my object. This camera took 36 seconds to focus. Yes, I timed it. Is this normal? because I've never experienced something like this. When I put a comparable camera to the same video test, maybe 4 seconds - and that's being generous. So go my hopes of an ergonomic and compact travel zoom. Another bright day shooter? Definitely. The giant FZ200 will suffice for now.Needless to say, I took the second 820 back after a week... and got a P520. Just couldn't help myself. Never owned a Nikon before the L series, maybe both were a dud. Guess what? Same exact crap! At stills the P520 is much better and will focus at 600+mm! (albeit very slowly - whoops, there goes the warbler!) but the video on that thing is the same way. It literally takes minutes to focus. Forget the shutter for a moment, the video tells me enough. What is up with these lenses? Do a test and put something dark on an all white background. Now stand back, zoom in, and focus. I am upgrading my L820 review from one star to two. The second model I received did not squeal (as loud), and didn't go haywire. But the zoom problems are still apparent in both the L and P series "flagshit" mega-zooms, brought to you straight from quality control Nikon plants. Makes me think twice about the dreamy 7100.

Reviews.Author: emily n jackson
Reviews.Content: Great size. Great option if you are looking for a long zoom point and shoot. I love the sport option. Takes a series of pictures within a few seconds. Reviews.Content: I was looking for an upgrade in cameras, specifically to take good close ups for my online business and for travel shots.  This one does it all, easily and beautifully. Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera, it came just when I expected and I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone.. You definitely  get more bang for you buck with this camera.. In fact after I got the first one, I went ahead and ordered another one as backup..

Reviews.Title: We're hobbiest photographers and this camera really fits our requirements well
Reviews.Author: MN Sunny C.
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I took a DSL community education class about a decade ago and since then we've really enjoyed shooting our outings, family get togethers, vacations, pets, etc.. In other words, the camera bug bit us both!This camera turned out to really fit our needs well. It is a great point and click camera whose pictures turn out really great without having to put a lot of effort into them. That's the way that I prefer it. My spouse on the other hand has a better grip on the advanced features so she can make the camera do some things that I don't know how like motion blurring, time spanning where the object starts at one place and ends in another, and just some strange things that I don't know how to do. I'm not sure about my names, blurring, spanning, hopefully you kind of understand what I'm trying to say. I apologize for my limited photography vocabulary.The camera also takes amazing videos. Full 1080p HD that look almost like a professional Hollywood production company stopped by and set up shop at our family get togethers! The camera lets you plug it directly into the TV and the computer. My spouse handles those duties since I'm not a real tech type, but the fact that the camera is able to do that it pretty cool if you ask me!I don't think that we would hesitate to buy this camera again. I know that we don't regret the purchase in the least. Perhaps it would not be the camera that we would choose at this price point today, since cameras have advanced and you can get a lot more for your ~$240'ish price point these days. Perhaps if there is updated version of this camera? In any event, the camera has not had a single hiccup and it's still going strong to this day! One last thing, the four AA Eneloop Rechargeable Batteries last a very long time, it's really quite surprising. Actually the battery life is probably one of the coolest things about the CoolPix camera now that I think of it. Rechargeables are the way to go, Eneloop rechargeables work great with a good La Crosse Battery Charger (the charger that comes with the Eneloops is garbage) but that's a different review I guess...

Reviews.Title: What a great camera! Worth the price

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "karenzkritterz"
Reviews.Content: First off, the camera is not red as is stated, nor is it a pukey pink as shown. It's a very nice, rich burgundy color, with parts of it being black. Very pretty, and has a nice weight to it. NOT a pocket camera, it feels more like one of the old 35mm cameras, but lighter.The zoom function is a bit slow to focus, and goes in and out of focus more than I'd like, and there is a definite pause between pressing the shutter release and the picture actually being taken, but most of the time it catches the correct image.  This is NOT a 30x zoom; if you zoom in most or all the way, your image will be VERY fuzzy.  If you zoom tightly while videoing, you will lose focus several times while the camera "finds" its focal point, and you can hear the hum of the lense moving on the video.  The lense cap is not attached to the camera, and if you try to turn it on with the cap on, you get a "Lense Cap Error" message, and have to turn the camera off and back on after removing the cap. That's a pain, and I can easily imagine the cap getting lost the first time I take the camera anywhere.  It should have a loop that attaches to the wrist strap or something. Those are the only negatives I've found so far.It takes a few sessions to get comfortable with the camera, but once you do, you'll be able to get beautiful, crisp images with excellent color.  There are some great macros; I especially like the one for photographing flowers.  There are also some filters you can use on your photos, but IMO, they're useless. The Panoramic function works very nicely; you have your choice of 180° or 360°, and a slider in the viewport guides your speed. You'll need a memory card; Amazon has some good ones for good prices.If you're tired of using your phone to take pics and vids, and want something that'll give you really nice photos and good videos, this is a great camera to go with. A GREAT buy for the money!!

Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for two weeks now. It has met all my expectations, and I am very happy with it. The powerful zoom does create problems when you are holding the camera without a tripod and you zoom it to the maximum. Most of the shots I took were blurred because of movement after the focus.

Reviews.Author: galac11
Reviews.Content: Wife has a true DSLR Nikon, and I have been wanting something a bit more than a point and shoot pocket camera. The CoolPix L820 has very good low light capability and up to 30X zoom, so it lets me do a lot more in terms of outdoor- nature- pictures. I am not ready for a full blown DSLR yet, so this was a good choice.One minor gripe is that it has very poor ability to focus at closer distances when using the higher zoom levels, and the loss of focus is sudden, compounded by a slightly insensitive zoom control. It makes some close up shots hard to impossible, where my little point and shoot camera works.After a few weeks of using it I am even more pleased. I have been amazed too at the long battery life. Image quality is quite good, the zoom and low light capabilities are simply great.I noticed some complaints about the lens cover attaching to the body- I find that there is no problem in use, and the camera failing to extend the lens and come on is a quick clue to take the cotton picking cover off. It certainly seems to be designed to deal with that, and I am starting to remember to drop the lens cover FIRST. :)I recently got an accessory kit with tripod, SD card reader, case, and cleaning kit, and find the card reader eases transfer of pictures to the computer.

Reviews.Content: I'm loving every aspect of this camera so far. Picture quality, video quality, ease of use while still having user controls. I'm really pleased by the turn on time. Reviews.Content: I am very impressed at the quality you get at this price.  The superzoom is perfect for school events.  The video recording is excellent as well.  I wholly recommend this camera.  The only drawback is that everything is automatic.
