Reviews.Title: Great photos but missing the little things.
Reviews.Author: PeoplePhobic
Reviews.Content: First, let me just say that no matter what follows in this review the camera is very easy to use and takes great photos.The camera body is not well thought out. If you have a tripod mount on the camera you cannot open the battery door/sd card bay. If you work with a tripod a lot this becomes extremely cumbersome. The camera does not come with an AC adapter and thought the ac adapter would be only 5v you cannot power the camera through the included USB cable. I usually do product photography with a light box and continuous lights so it's lack of a hot shoe was not an issue. The camera also works without horizontal banding under florescent lights (some don't). The camera is a point-and-shoot but has some cool semi-manual settings.I usually expect to get a SD-card and an AC adapter with my camera. The ac adapter is like $45. Also, the camera has HDMI out but requires a micro hdmi cable or something that it again does not come with.Again though the camera takes really good photos with minimal fuss. It's just missing the little things (like all of them).Update: I ended up returning the camera. It's lack of an adaptor burned through all my batteries while taking product photos. Then nearly complete on a new project I opened the door that the sd card and batteries share and dropped a battery and lost it under some equipment I couldn't move. So I had to end up using my old camera to finish the job. After going back to it I just felt that it  was a much better workflow and I am going to look for a camera more similar to that one. It's just a pain to need to take the tripod mount off to get into the sd card/battery bay. If I was taking nature walks or taking a bunch of pics on vacation or something this would be a great camera for me.Even though I'm returning the camera I'm going to give it another star because it has seriously amazing zoom. I have bought lenses that don't have this much zoom that cost more than this camera.If you need to get to the SD card a lot and you use a tripod it just doesn't work. If you don't need that you'll be hard pressed to find a better camera in it's price range. I do love the it but it doesn't work for me.

Reviews.Content: We were looking for a device that can capture both pictures and videos well. Reviews.Content: Get it you'll love it.  Many features.  Want break the bank.  Good zoom.  Very happy!  Battery life is good.  We use it at the ball field, does the job.  Best camera I have ever owned!  BC--Rockamrt Ga.

Reviews.Title: I thought Nikon was better than this.  I was certainly proven wrong.
Reviews.Author: William J. Sagaberd
Reviews.Content: I have no idea where to start about this poor excuse of a product.How about I start with a list of physical and operational defects:1) The rubber thumb cushion pad near the record button was already falling off.2) Another rubber part, the hand grip below the shutter button was not completely attached.3) The Self-timer/AF-Assistant lamp didn't work.4)  The flash could not be raised/opened.5)  ***There was a partial finger print on the INSIDE of the lens. Couldn't be removed.****I thought Nikon made quality products.  I cannot think of any plausible reason why this unit should have been allowed out of the factory.I spent several days researching for a replacement to a Canon SX10 that was destroyed in an accident.  I order this Nikon model over another Canon model because of the 30x optical zoom.  I also ordered so as to use at a historic family function this past weekend.Now I'll go into the critical flaws I found in this device.I soon realized the flash would no deploy, so I took a tripod on the trip figuring I could work around this seeing how I didn't have a choice at this point.  However, every time I would depress the shutter button I would get a "RAISE THE FLASH" warning.  This even happened outside in the bright sunlight.  Now when I decide I do not want to use a flash for a picture that is what I expect the camera to do.  I do not want it to tell me I am wrong or force me to use it's suggestion.  The firmware is suppose to assist you, and not dictate what it thinks is correct.Next I found the extending and retracting of the lens was extremely noisy.  People within 10 feet of me were asking what was wrong with my camera.  Between the noise of the zoom and the whirring noise of the auto-focus This problem completely obliterated the audio of a five minute video I took.The auto focus didn't use the center of the lens as described on page 28 of the users manual.  Reference number 24 on page 8 of the manual shows a double bracket [  ] that depicts where the focus point is.  Instead I found the focus point was about half-way from center to the right side and about 1/3 the distance from center to top.(Diagonally up to the right)  So I again adjusted my actions trying to accommodate another problem.  I would shift the focus point and depress the shutter button half-way to lock the focus and exposure, reported by a beep, then I would re-frame my shot.  However every time I heard the beep and started to move the camera the exposure and focus would change while holding the shutter button partially depressed.  At the top of page 29 in the users manual its says that should not happen.  A relative pointed out that the AF-Assist lamp wasn't working, but that doesn't explain why it was focusing away from the center of the frame.In the approximately 72 hours I used the camera at this historic family event I took 417 pictures. Out of that I i would say I have only 31(7.43%) that are usable or worth saving.  My mother got better results from her four year old 1.1 MP LG flip phone.I'm not a novice and I am certainly by no means a professional photographer; however, this camera was a complete and utter disaster.  I may get my purchase price refunded to me.  I wasted a lot of time and effort trying to work around these problems, but that pales in comparison to the family history and once in a lifetime images I failed to capture.All I can say right now is disappointment would be an extremely grotesque understatement.

Reviews.Title: memory card not included
Reviews.Author: Stephenie L. Falcone "au natural"
Reviews.Content: OK I buy a camera about once every 10 years, so I had no idea that the memory card is not included.  I can't take more than a 5 second video, and my son's birthday is today. So it looks like we're going to Best Buy.  Also the CD-Rom does not play on my computer, it doesn't even show up, and I have Adobe, so I don't get it. The paper manual that comes with it is very basic and isn't answering my questions.Otherwise it's a very nice camera.  I would have gladly paid more to have the memory card included, I think that's dumb and would love to know if there's a good reason, they included everything else, even batteries.  I can get double A batteries anywhere, finding a last minute memory card is a pain.  I bet a bunch of people are going to be like, duh everybody knows this, but I didn't, and I don't recall reading anything about it before I bought it, and I read everything.Oh well.

Reviews.Title: Not pleased with the AF and Scenes
Reviews.Author: Jared Orth
Reviews.Content: I bought the L820 after doing a lot of research about the features, zoom, abilities.  I missed out on the fact that there are NO manual options for exposure.  Also, the AF seemed to have problems in portrait when zooming in.  Pictures of my son, who was sitting rather still, would end up focused on the items around him, while he was slightly blurry.  I returned the camera for the fact that I don't want to go on vacation, and get home just to find that a lot of the people were blurry.

Reviews.Content: I really like the zoom capacity, the clarity of the photos and the options on this camera. What I dont like is that it takes AA batteries and if you want rechargeables you have to buy them separate for $50. I did buy them b/c I love having this camera around and ready. It's not too heavy or too big. Because of the weight it is not for carrying around all the time like my pocket size point and shoot is. I got the camera in plum color and it's very pretty. It has tons of different scene options. Some work better than others but all are good. The close up option is amazing. You can photograph a text message and it reads clearly. I bought it last month before I could find any reviews on it. I am glad i took the risk.

I would LOVE to return it but I am past the 30 day window so I can't.  I have a 2 year old and every photo is blurry.  My christmas photos are ruined. Reviews.Title: camera really nice

Reviews.Author: Sandy McDowell
Reviews.Content: Bought this so we could record video and not just pictures. Gave this to my husband so we could record his speeches for his speech class for college. The first time we used the video was ok but the 2nd 3rd and 4th time we tried it would record but when you played it back on the camera or computer/TV it would skip, the sound and lips did not match up. What a big disappointment coming from a Nikon Camera/Video. Can not return it as my 30 days are up. If I want I can ship it to a Nikon dealer but I have to pay shipping both ways don't think it's worth the money to do that. We have tried many things to get it to work like new batteries different SD cards nothing made it better. I would not recommend this product to anyone. Maybe I got a lemon I know that happens. But to not get much help to fix the problem that's very disappointing. i Wish I could return it back to Amazon but I can't I wish I would have know this 2 weeks ago so I could have returned..

Reviews.Title: Replacement batteries didn't hold up
Reviews.Author: Jonathon Lutz
Reviews.Content: I bought a Coolpix L810 3 weeks ago. I made several videos with it as well as some stills, all on the set of AA batteries of AA batteries that came with it. It worked great.Yesterday I took it out of its case, loaded new batteries and tried to shoot video. It immediately started eating batteries. A brand new set of batteries only lasted about 15 seconds then the camera shut down. You can watch the battery power drop as it goes. Then I figured out that the batteries that came with it, though they say they are Alkaline AA, are more powerful than the ones I was trying to use. I went to the store and got some rechargables and it seems OK again. Shoots very good pictures and video.
